loans.name: Rosibel Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Rosibel del Carmen Velásquez , tiene la edad de 41 años , habita en el barrio San Ignacio , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos , una de 20 y otro de 19 años , estos jóvenes estudian y en sus tiempos libres le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y seguir apoyando a sus hijos, doña Rosibel desde hace 30 años , se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es el mal tiempo y el financiamiento , los planes hacia un futuro es poder diversificar el cultivo. Este es su sexto crédito en Afodenic el cual va a invertir en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo. Con esto espera poder obtener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio al mercado, da las gracia a la institución por los beneficios obtenidos.
texts.en:
Rosibel del Carmen Velásquez is 41 years old. She lives with her husband, who works to contribute to household expenses, in the San Ignacio neighborhood, located in the town of Concepción. They have two children, a daughter who is 20 and a son who is 19, both of whom are in school and help out with the agricultural work in their free time. Rosibel's plans for her family are to improve their living conditions and continue to support their children. She has worked in agriculture for the past 30 years. The greatest difficulties she faces are bad weather and financing. Her plans for the future are to diversify her crops. This is her sixth loan with Afodenic, which she will use to purchase raw materials and fertilizers for the crops. With this she hopes to have a good harvest to sell for a good price in the market. She is thankful to the institution for the benefits she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim M. is the leader of the Biva Muntuuyo group in Kayunga. He is married with six children that are all in school. He is a business man who has had a tailoring business for 12 years. He makes casual and formal suits for men. He is well known for the services he renders and this wins him many loyal customers. In the shop, he employs three people to utilize the four sewing machines he owns. They help run the business with him, making more suits and more money.

He is requesting a loan to buy more suit materials for his business so that he has a variety.

loans.use: To buy more suit materials for his business.

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group 2

texts.en:
Dionorat is the leader of the group L. Fortaleza 2, which translates as "The Strength." This group is seeking a loan to help them grow their small businesses in the town of Hato Mayor on the eastern sector of the Dominican Republic. This is a group maD. up of friends and family that has successfully taken out three loans in the past and has supported one another in their entrepreneurial ventures.

Diornat owns a clothing store that she started two years ago. With this loan, she will buy more pants and blouses to sell in her store. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can continue to support her two children, aged 13 and 16, and be able to send them to college.

Diornat and the entire L. Fortaleza 2 group have greatly appreciated the opportunities that their microloans have given them and they hope to continue in their success.

loans.use: To buy pants and blouses for her clothing store.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco “SANTO DOMINGO”, ellos son 16 socios, y todos residen en el valle sagrado de los inkas, en Urubamba, ubicado a 1 hora en auto, desde la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios se dedican al comercio minorista, ellos alternan sus actividades del hogar, una socia vende comidas en la plazoleta de serrachayoc, otra socia tiene un restaurant  pollería y desea implementar mejor su negocio, otra socia tiene un video pub y ella quiere comprar más vasos, bebidas y música, otros socios tiene restaurant, tienda de abarrotes, venta de videos, venta de comidas al paso, todos ellos ubicados en la provincia de Urubamba, para lo cuál requieren el préstamo para poder implementar sus diferentes negocios pequeños.

Los socios se encuentran muy agradecidos y ratifican su compromiso de cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
There are 16 partners of the bank "SANTO DOMINGO" and they all live in the sacred valley of the Inkas, in Urubamba, 1 hour by car from the town of Cusco.

Our partners work as retail dealers which they alternate with their chores. One partner sells food at the plaza of Serrachayoc, another one has a chicken restaurant and wishes to improve her business, another one has a video pub and wishes to buy more glasses, beverages, and music, other partners have restaurant, general store, video sale, food sale. They are all located in the province of Urubamba, and they all require the loan to be able to improve their different small businesses.

The partners are very thankful and state their commitment to repay the total of their debts punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve different businesses.

loans.name: Tomas Aquilino

texts.es: El señor Tomas Aquilino López Sánchez , tiene la edad de 42 años , habita en el barrio Denis Larios , junto con su compañera de vida , la cual le poya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos , los tres estudian y le poyan con las actividades del campo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , don Tomas desde hace 21 años , se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas , el inicio esta actividad agrícola , con sus propios esfuerzos y el de sus padres que le poyaban , los planes hacia un futuro en sus tierras es diversificar sus productos . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y aplicar al cultivo lo cual espera obtener una buena cosecha. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo de los  préstamo lo cual se beneficia para mejorar sus cultivo como sus vida personal.
texts.en:
Mr. Tomas Aquilino López Sánchez is 42 years old and lives in the neighborhood Denis Larios together with his companion who supports him doing the chores. They have three children, all students who help with the farm activities. The family plans are to improve the conditions of their home. Don Tomas has been a farmer for 21 years and the mayor difficulties he faces are lack of financing and plagues. He started as a farmer with his own efforts and the support of his parents and his future plans are to diversify the crops. With the loan he will buy fertilizers and supplies for the crops and he hopes to get a good harvest. He thanks Afodenic for the support of the loans as he benefits in order to improve his farming as well as his personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to improve crops

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 59 años, está a cargo de su hija y de su nieta a quienes trata de brindarles las mejores condiciones de vida. Hace varios años trabajó en diversas actividades siendo la venta de cosméticos una de las más recientes y con la cual viene solventando sus gastos. Por ello, trata de dedicarse a su negocio de la mejor manera, en todo tiempo del día, dentro y fuera de su casa puesto que sus clientas siempre la visitan para adquirir algunos productos que tiene en stock. Asimismo sale a visitar a algunos clientes llevando los catálogos para que realicen sus pedidos, lo cual le toma gran parte del día debido a las distancias que tiene que recorrer, pero lo más cansado es realizar las cobranzas, las cuales son indispensables para que siga invirtiendo en su negocio. Con el tiempo, Alicia espera incrementar la cantidad de productos que tiene en stock y trabajar con varias líneas de belleza, además desea tener la capacidad de implementar un bazar donde pueda ofrecer estos productos. Con Microfinanzas PRISMA ya tiene 24 préstamos y dentro de su banco comunal ha sabido aprovechar las oportunidades de desarrollo, junto a sus compañeras trabajan arduamente para que sigan adelante como grupo. Los 3200 que ahora solicita le servirán para la compra de productos de belleza por docenas y aprovechar las ofertas de los catálogos.
texts.en:
Alicia is 59 years old. She is responsible for her daughter and granddaughter, whom she tries to offer the most comfortable life she can. She has various sorts of work over the years; most recently, she has done cosmetics sales, which helps her cover her expenses. She tries to do her best at her work, at all hours of the day and in and out of her house, since her clients always visit her to obtain the products she has in stock. She also goes out to take catalogs to some clients so they can make their orders, which takes up a good portion of the day since she has to travel long distances. But her most tiring task is to collect payments for invoices, which is essential so she can continue to invest in her business. In time, Alicia hopes to increase the quantity of products she stocks and work with a number of brands of beauty products. She also hopes to be able to set up a little store in which to sell her products. She has already had 24 loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and her communal bank has helped her take advantage of opportunities for growth. She and her companions work hard to move ahead as a group. The 3200 soles she is now requesting will help her buy wholesale beauty products and take advantage of catalog specials.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 54 años y junto a su esposo tratan de brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida a su único hijo, por ello construyeron su casa propia donde viven cómodamente. Cuando terminó la construcción de ésta pensó en instalar un negocio, comenzó vendiendo bebidas durante el verano, pero con el tiempo las personas demandaban muchas cosas más, lo cual fue el inicio de su bodega. Esta actividad la viene realizando hace 5 años trabajando desde las 6 de la mañana aseando su local, arreglando sus productos y preparándose para atender a sus clientes con una gran sonrisa, pues más importante que vender en demasía es brindar una atención adecuada a sus clientes ya que esa actitud garantizará el desarrollo y rentabilidad de su negocio, nos dice. Para un futuro cercano, Lucia quiere ampliar su tienda acondicionando un espacio adicional en su casa. Ella considera que el trabajo que realiza en su banco comunal es primordial, puesto que lo realiza en comunión con todas las integrantes de su grupo, utilizando estos créditos como una alternativa de desarrollo. Para Lucia este es su 13vo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA. Los 3000 soles que solicita los usará para la ampliación del local de su tienda.
texts.en:
Lucia is 54 years old and, together with her husband, is trying to provide better living conditions for their only son. That is why they built their own house, where they are now living comfortably. When they finished constructing their home Lucia thought about setting up a business. She began by selling beverages during the summer, but soon her customers were asking for many more items. This led to Lucia establishing her grocery store. She has been involved in this activity for 5 years. She begins work at 6 in the morning by tidying up the store, arranging her products, and getting ready to attend to her customers with a big smile. Lucia tells us that one of the secrets to selling a lot of products is to provide suitable attention to her customers, and having that attitude will guarantee her business’s development and profitability. In the near future Lucia wants to expand her store, setting up an additional space in her home. She thinks that the work she does in her communal bank is very important, since she works together with all of the members of her group, using the loans as a good development alternative. This is Lucia’s 13th loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas PRISMA. She will use the 3000 soles she is requesting to expand the premises of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her store

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una mujer de 53 años, nos dice que estar casada es la mejor etapa de su vida, ya que se siente realizada como mujer con su familia: su esposo y sus hijos. La venta de cosméticos en una actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años a raíz de la invitación de una amiga, quien la animó a ganar dinero a través de la venta por catálogo de productos de belleza. Desde entonces visita a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares para ofrecerles diversos productos; esta labor la realiza todas las tardes para ocuparse de su familia en las mañanas. Durante sus horas de trabajo distribuye sus pedidos y realiza las cobranzas, aunque su visión es trabajar con varias líneas de belleza para diversificar los productos y tener mayores oportunidades de venta. Desde que emprendió este negocio, María ha llegado a apasionarse por su labor, además los reconocimientos e incentivos que le dan las empresas de belleza la motivan para seguir adelante. Con Microfinanzas PRISMA ya tiene 13 créditos, siendo parte de su banco comunal, donde el trabajo en conjunto es una de las características de su grupo por lo que le agrada formar parte de él. María desea aprovechar las ofertas en los catálogos para adquirir varios productos, por lo que ahora solicita 2000 soles para ello.
texts.en:
Maria is a 53 year old woman, who says that being married is the best stage of her life, since she feels fulfilled as a woman with her family, husband and children. She has been selling cosmetics for the past 3 years after being invited by a friend, who encouraged her to make some money through beauty catalog sales. Since then she visits her neighbors, friends and family to offer various products. She does this work every afternoon to take care of her family in the mornings. During her work hours she distributes orders and collects payments, although her vision is to work with several different product lines to diversify the products and to have greater sales opportunities. Since she started this business, Maria has become passionate about her job, and the recognition and incentives that beauty companies give her have motivated her to keep going. With Microfinanzas PRISMA she already has had 13 loans as part of the communal bank, where team work is one of the characteristics of her group that makes her like being a part of it. Maria wishes to take advantage of the offers in the catalogs to purchase several products, so she is asking for 2000 soles for this purpose.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 37 años, es casada. Como familia, junto a su esposo e hijos buscan salir adelante; por ello, uno de sus mayores logros ha sido la construcción de su casa propia. La habilidad que tiene para la elaboración de bocaditos le ha dado la oportunidad de iniciar hace 6 años su negocio de producción y venta de chocolates, lo cuales distribuye a las tiendas de su localidad y en las diversas reuniones sociales donde se lo solicitan. Estos contratos son más rentables, puesto que los pedidos son en grandes cantidades, de venta fija y ganancia rápida. A pesar de la tediosa preparación de los chocolates, Martha trata de disfrutarla junto a sus hijos, trabajando alegremente todos los días desde las 2 de la tarde hasta altas horas de la noche, tiempo que varía dependiendo del pedido, pues ha habido noches enteras sin dormir con tal de cumplir, pero su sacrificio tuvo su recompensa en las ganancias obtenidas. Para un futuro cercano, Martha quiere tener una fuente de soda donde pueda ofrecer variedades de bocaditos y chocolates. Este es su 13avo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, el tiempo de permanencia con su banco comunal ha sido de grandes posibilidades de desarrollo, ya que el trabajo en equipo que realiza con sus compañeras la ha ayudado a solucionar diversas circunstancias adversas. Los 2500 soles que solicita los invertirán en la compra de los ingredientes indispensables para la preparación de sus deliciosos bocaditos.
texts.en:
Martha is 37 years old and married. She seeks to succeed as a family with her husband and children; one of their greatest achievements was to build their own home. The skills she has to produce snacks gave her 6 years ago the opportunity to start her own chocolate production and sale business, and she distributes them at her local stores and in several social gatherings where she gets the orders. These sales are the most profitable, since the orders are in large quantities, fixed sales with a quick gain. Despite the tedious preparation of the chocolates, Martha tries to enjoy it next to her children, working happily every day from 2 in the afternoon until late at night. The time varies depending on the order, since there have been many nights when she didn't sleep just so she could fulfill an order, but her sacrifice has been rewarded with profits. In the near future Martha wants to have a soda fountain where she can offer snacks and chocolates. This is her 13th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. The long time she has been with the communal bank has been full of development possibilities, since the teamwork she does with her partners have helped her pull through several adverse situations. The 2500 soles she asks for will be invested in the purchase of ingredients that are necessary for the preparation of her delicious snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for her snacks and chocolates

loans.name: Villa Asencion 1, 4, 5 Group

texts.en:
Villa Asencion is a community located between Puerto Plata and Sosua in the Dominican Republic. This community is a mission project that was constructed by American missionaries in an attempt to improve the lives of Haitian immigrants living in the Dominican Republic. Tragically, there have been several outbursts of racial violence in the community.

The sturdy concrete houses in the community were built exclusively for the Haitian immigrants and given to them for free. Some local Dominicans have taken this as discrimination, and have responded by breaking into Haitian homes and stealing their things, often times materials used for their businesses. Many Haitians have fled the community for fear of being robbed. Consequently, the local entrepreneurs have had a difficult time starting successful business ventures within the community.

Marie B. one of three group leaders in the Villa Asencion loan group. She has started a business making purses and messenger bags. She sews all of her bags herself and sells them to tourists at nearby resorts. Despite the civil unrest, her business has had considerable success. She is on her third micro-loan, and plans to take out more loans in the future. Her husband is a construction worker, which means his work is inconsistent. He usually has to travel to wherever there are construction projects in order to find work. Marie has worked very hard in his absence to be a consistent source of income for her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to make purses and bags.

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group 4

texts.en:
Ana is an outstanding example of the opportunity that microloans provide to people all over the world. Ana is 38 years old and is part of a group called La Fortaleza, or The Strength, that takes out loans as a group and supports each other in business ventures. 

Ana has been running a retail store for 8 years and she sells goods such as purses, perfumes, clothes and shoes. However, she her dream is to work in the capital, Santo Domingo, as a nurse. She is now on her third loan cycle, trying to increase her profits so that she can work her way through college to earn her nursing degree. She already has one child, aged 18, in college and she hopes that with a career in nursing she can afford to provide her other three children (aged 13, 11, and 9) with college education as well.

With this loan she will buy more sneakers and high heeled shoes as those products sell the most. 

Ana and the entire La Fortaleza group are excited to receive another loan and come one step closer to achieving their dreams.

loans.use: To buy shoes for her retail store

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: Petronila es una mujer con un ejemplo a seguir debido a las diversas dificultades que supo enfrentar como cabeza de su hogar, el cual está conformado por sus 3 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que le costó mucho construir. Desde muy joven estuvo involucrada en diversos negocios de comercio, lo cual fue perfeccionando sus habilidades para las ventas. Esto ha sido de gran valor desde que tomó la decisión de separarse de su pareja y pasó a asumir diversos roles dentro de su casa. Ahora, gracias a su negocio de venta de ropa en el puesto que tiene en el mercado está solventando las necesidades de su familia. Petronila trabaja todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, tiempo en que atiende a sus clientas quienes son muy exigentes a la hora de comprar, por lo que trata de mantener su puesto con prendas de calidad y a la moda. Petronila espera que su negocio siga mejorando para que pronto pueda obtener otro puesto que pueda alquilar y tener un ingreso adicional. Este es su 18avo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal es el compromiso y responsabilidad con los que trabajan todas las personas que conforman grupo. Los 1500 soles que solicita están destinados a la compra de mercadería, ya que la temporada de invierno demanda nuevas prendas de vestir y Petronila necesita estar acorde a la exigencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Petronila sets an example to follow as a woman who has known how to face many difficulties as the head of her household. She lives with her three children in the house that cost her lot to build. She has been involved in various selling businesses from a very early age, and she has been perfecting her skills in sales. This has been very valuable to her since she made the decision to separate from her significant other and assume the various roles in her house. Now, thanks to her business of selling clothes in the stall she has at the market, she is supporting the family’s needs. Petronila works every day from nine in the morning until six at night. During that time she waits on her customers, who are very demanding when they buy. Therefore, she tries to keep her stall stocked with quality articles of clothing that are in style. Petronila hopes that her business continues to improve so that she will soon be able to rent another stall and have an additional income. This is her 18th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. What she likes best about her community bank is the way that all of the group members work responsibly and with commitment. The 1,500 PEN that she is asking for is to buy merchandise. The winter time demands new clothes, and Petronila needs to meet her customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Yelna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Yelna Isabel R. A., tiene la edad de 42 años , habita en el barrio San Juan , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijas , ya casadas e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder comprar un terreno y heredar a sus hijas , doña Yelna desde hace 11 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo ya que carecen de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para combatirlas, ella inicio esta actividad con esfuerzos propios . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Yelna Isabel R. A. is 42. She lives in the San Juan neighborhood, which is located in the Concepción municipality. She lives with her husband. He works and helps her with the household expenses. They have two married and independent daughters. Their family plans are to improve their living conditions and to be able to buy a piece of land for their daughters to inherit. Yelna has been farming for 11 years. The biggest difficulty is the pests that affect the crop because they lack the necessary fertilizers and supplies to combat them. She started the business with her own efforts. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to improve her crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers to apply to the crop

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Azangaro, Provincia D. Azangaro, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 49 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 05 hijos (dos a su cargo), tiene estudios D. segundaria incompleta (3er Grado),  vive en el Barrio Vilcapaza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra D. lubricantes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. lubricantes y así tener stock.

Su mayor deseo es poner un grifo (venta D. gasolina).

A ella le gusta el orden con que se maneja su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Señora Cristina belongs to the Flor Azangarina II (Flower of Azángaro, 2nd) Communal Bank which is located in the District and Province of Azángaro, Department of Puno. She is 49 years of age, in a civil marriage and is the mother of five children, two of whom are in her care. She has an incomplete secondary education and lives in the Vilcapaza neighborhood. She's been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last two years. Her first loan was for 500 New Sols which was used to buy lubricants. At this time, she needs a loan of 2,000 New Sols to buy lubricants for her inventory. Her greatest wish is to open a gas station. She likes orderly way her Communal Bank is managed.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lubricants.

loans.name: Demetrio Caledonio

texts.es: El señor Demetrio Celedonio O. C., tiene la edad de 53 años, habita  en el barrio la Borgoña, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar, ellos tiene nueve hijos , el de 27 , 25 ,23, trabajan y le poyan , los de 22,18,17,14,11y 8 años estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 15 años , don Demetrio trabaja en la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, el inicio esta actividad por esfuerzos propios . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para tener mejor producción y vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Demetrio Celedonio O. C., 53, lives in the Borgoña neighborhood, which is located in the Ticuantepe municipality. He lives with his wife; she helps him with household activities. They have nine children. The children who are 27, 25, and 23 work and help him. The children who are 22, 18, 17, 14, 11, and 8 currently go to school. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. Demetrio has been farming for 15 years. The biggest difficulty he has is lack of financing. He started this business through his own efforts. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to increase production and sell for a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to increase production

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar Sánchez , tiene la edad de 52 años , habita en el barrio San Caralampio, ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposa , la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene cuatro hijos , todos dependen de él , actualmente estudian y la apoyan con las actividades agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda , desde hace 3 años don Julio se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, el inicio esta actividad por si solo , los planes hacia un futuro con su cultivo , es que quiere tecnificarlo. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Cesar Sánchez is 52 years old and lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood in the town of Concepción. He and his wife have four dependent children who attend school. Julio works as a farmer to support his family, and his wife supports him by handling all the household chores.

He and his family plan to improve their living conditions. Don Julio has been farming for three years, and his greatest challenge has been a lack of funding. His work involves a great deal of manual labor that he does himself, so he would like to mechanize his farm in the future. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizer and other supplies to help increase his harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and farming supplies

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Ma-Mary is a woman of 54 who has 9 children and 16 grand-children to watch over.  Many of her children have gone on to higher education, but some are still small or in school.   

 Ma-Mary’s business is selling fish.  She goes to a company in Monrovia and buys her fish for re-selling.  She then takes these fish to Water-Side Market and sells them on one of the market tables.    

Currently she is very focused on her business because she realizes that she is getting old and she wants to have savings for when she can no longer work.

loans.use: 5 bags of fish

loans.name: Fraternite Group

texts.en:
The “Fraternite” or “Fraternity” Bank of Hope group includes both male and female entrepreneurs, who belong to northern Haiti. After successfully repaying their first loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with the 2nd loan. Wilner D. is one of four representatives of the group. He is a hardworking, 26-year-old man.

Wilner says he “mixes it up” with a variety of products selling mostly bamboo, vegetables and charcoal. He is happy that he could buy his tools outright and invest more in his business. The larger investments has given him increased profits, which in turn allowed him to help his family by saving ~ USD35 (1400gds). Wilner says, “Though things are hard, I’m thankful for the assistance. I hope to be a good steward over what has been given to me and to see it grows in the future.” Wilner and Esperanza thank you for your support.

loans.use: bamboo, tools for cutting and transport

loans.name: Hilda Fidelia

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Hilda es casada, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Hilda tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Hilda necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leche, arroz.
Los sueños D. Hilda son aumentar su negocio y surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the community bank “Poder”. She is 56 years old, married and has 3 children. Hilda has a small grocery shop at her house, where she works every day. Hilda is asking for a loan of $200 which will be invested in the purchase of milk and rice. Hilda's dreams are to grow her business and offer more products.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es:
Elizabet es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Elizabet es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Elizabet vende productos plásticos como baldes, tinas, actividad que realiza todos los días ambulatoriamente en el mercado Nery García.
Elizabet necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de jarras, baldes.
Los sueños de Elizabet son tener una tienda grande de plásticos y locería, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the community bank “Poder”. She is 34 years old and has 2 children. She sells products such as plastic buckets and tubs, at the streets of Nery García's market in a daily basis.

Elizabeth is asking for a loan of $300 which will be invested in buying jars and buckets. Her dreams are to open a shop to sell plastic products and to provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Grupo: NUEVA ESPERANZA.
Ciclo: 8. (numero de veces que han recibido un crèdito)
Fecha de desembolso: 3/06/2 009.
Monto: 46,000
Plazo de pago: 8 Catorcenas



El señor: PEDRO CHACON L., de 47 años  es originario de acatlàn de Pérez Figueroa  Oaxaca, un pueblo pequeño de la región de Tuxtepec.

 Desde su juventud se ha dedicado al oficio de la carpintería,  el señor Pedro actualmente esta separado de su esposa, pero es responsable de una niña y un niño que procrearon en matrimonio  don Pedro anhela con poder  ampliar su carpintería, contar con mas herramientas que le permitan  desarrollar mejor su oficio y así poder darles mejor calidad de vida a sus niños como el los llama el desea que sus hijos  aprendan que el trabajo digno los hace mejores seres humanos y que aprendan  hacer buenos ciudadanos.   

 Por tal motivo el señor PEDRO CHACON L.  solicito un crédito con el afán de hacer su sueño realidad, ampliar su carpintería. Y será en este caso para la compra de madera, barnices etc. En otras palabras materia prima, que necesita para elaborar sus muebles.

Con esta finalidad el señor: PEDRO CHACON  L., se ha unido  aun grupo de 10 personas al cual le pusieron como nombre de grupo: NUEVA ESPERANZA. Para  solicitar  el crédito grupal a Fundación realidad A.C. las otras personas del grupo son:


Maria del carmen A. C.: venta de cosméticos.
Guadalupe T. M.             : venta de sabanas, cobijas.
Celestina T. Martínez              : venta de abarrotes
Margarita C. García        : venta de comida.
Estela Chacón López                        : venta de ropa.
Martina Ramón Gomes                        : venta de comida.
Petra A. Guzmán                       : venta de carne de puerco.
Zaray M. D.                        : venta de comida.
Estela López Ramírez             : compra y venta de carne de pollo.
texts.en:
Group: Nueva Esperanza. Loan Cycle: 8. (Number of times that they have received a loan.) Date of Disbursement: 3/06/2009. Amount: 46,000 Pesos Repayment Schedule: 8 bi-weekly payments. Señor Pedro Chacon L. is 47 years of age and comes from Acatlàn de Pérez Figueroa, Oaxaca, a small village in the Tuxtepec region. From the time he was young he has been a woodworker. Señor Pedro is currently separated from his wife but is responsible for a boy and a girl from that marriage. He really wants to expand his carpentry business and to have more tools that would allow him to better develop his trade. That way he would be able to provide a better standard of living for his children, as he calls them. He wants his children to learn that honorable work makes one a better human being and he wants them to learn to be good citizens. That's why Señor Pedro is seeking a loan with the desire of making his dream a reality, to expand his carpentry business. And in this case, it will be used to buy lumber, varnish, etc., in other words, the raw materials that he needs to produce his furniture. With this objective, Señor Pedro C. L. has brought together a group of ten people who call themselves the Nueva Esperanza Group in order to solicit a group loan from Fundación Realidad. The other members of the group are: Maria del Carmen A. C. . . . Cosmetics sales Guadalupe T. M. . . . Selling sheets and blankets Celestina T. Martínez . . . Grocery sales Margarita C. García . . . Selling prepared food Estela Chacón López . . . Clothing sales Martina Ramón Gomes . . . Selling prepared food Petra A. Guzmán . . . Selling pork Zaray M. D. . . . Selling prepared food Estela López Ramírez . . . Buying and selling chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and merchandise.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marcos Antonio F. P., tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el barrio Santa Rosa, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo cuatro hijos, todos estudiantes, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Marcos desde hace 10 años se dedica a los trabajos de ebanista, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos , los planes hacia un futuro para su taller es poder ampliar el área donde laboran. Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción y herramientas para trabajar y poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que le da mediante dos créditos y plazos para hacer la mejoras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos Antonio F. P. is 38 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Santa Rosa, located in the town of Ticuantepe, with his wife, who works and helps him with the household activities. They have four children, all of whom are students. Their plans for the future are to improve their lives. For 10 years, Mr. Marcos has been a cabinet-maker. The biggest difficulty that he has faced is a lack of financing. He began this activity through his own effort. In the future, he plans to increase the workspace in his workshop. With this loan, he is going to buy construction materials and work tools, so that he will be able to meet the demand of his clients. He thanks Afodenic for the support that they gave him by means of two loans and payments that allowed him to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and tools to make his products

loans.name: Maritza Zenaida

texts.es:
Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Maritza es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Maritza junto a su esposo tienen carros que alquilan para realizar taxi, además su esposo realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Maritza también vende ropa a pedido que vende al crédito.
Maritza necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos y batería para su carro.
Los sueños de Maritza son tener una negocio estable y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Power Community Bank. Martiza is married, is 28 years old, and has two children. Maritza and her husband have cars that they rent as taxis. Also, her husband operates a taxi in the city of Ayacucho. Maritza also sells specially-ordered clothes on credit. Maritza needs a loan of 750 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of spare tires and batteries for her car. Maritza’s dreams are to have a stable business and to offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare tires and batteries for her car

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Pelagia es casada, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Pelagia viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales, productos que vende en la ciudad de Cañete a donde viaja cada 15 días, además Pelagia vende papa en el mercado de Covadonga.
Pelagia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales y papa.
Los sueños de Pelagia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un puesto propio.
texts.en:
Pelagia is a member of the Power Community Bank. She is married, is 39 years old, and has 5 children. Pelagia travels to fairs, where she buys cereals, which she sells in the city of Cañete, where she travels every 15 days. Also, Pelagia sells potatoes in the market of Covadonga. Pelagia needs a loan of 1050 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of cereals and potatoes. Pelagia’s dreams are for her children become professionals and to have her own stand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals and potatoes

loans.name: Liudmila Yovana

texts.es:
Liudmila es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Liudmila es soltera, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Liudmila vende ropa a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Liudmila trabaja en una tienda de ropa de bebe como vendedora.
Liudmila necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas.
Los sueños de Liudmila son tener una tienda estable y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Liudmilia is a member of the Power Community Bank. Liudmila is single, is 28 years old, and has one child. Liudmila sells specially-ordered clothes, which she offers to her family and friends. Her sales are made on credit. Also, Liudmila works at a baby-clothing store as a retailer. Liudmila needs a loan of 1050 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sweaters. Liudmila’s dreams are to have a stable store and to offer a good education to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters

loans.name: Jesus Never Fails Group

texts.en:
Orethra is 38-year-old woman who was never able to attend school – but who is now able to send her 5 children and the son of her late brother to a private school because of her business.    

Orethra has a business selling homemade bread.  She makes her bread at her house and then she walks around selling it.  She says that people buy bread from her because her bread is very high quality.    

Orethra believes that her business would grow significantly if she could open a store where she could be baking and selling from.  This is one of the dreams that she has for the future.  She hopes that if she is able to expand her business enough she will be able to build a home for her and her family.

loans.use: baking goods such as flour, baking soda, and also rice

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Teodosia es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Teodosia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como conejo, gallinas, cuy, actividad que realiza en su casa con la ayuda de sus hijos, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de alimento para animales.
Los sueños de Teodosia son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Power Community Bank. Teodosia is married, is 56 years old, and has 6 children. Teodosia raises small animals like rabbits, hens, and guinea pigs. She pursues this activity in her house with the help of her children. She makes her sales in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Teodosia needs a loan of 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of food for the animals. Teodosia’s dreams are to improve her business and for her children to finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for the animals

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Julia es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, además Julia por las tardes vende salchipollos en la puerta de su tienda.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Julia son tener una tienda mayorista y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Power Communal Bank group. She is 32 years old, has three children, and lives with her partner. Julia has a rented shop where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat. She also sells “salchipollos” (a dish consisting of fried chicken, sausages, and potatoes) in the evening from the front of her store.

Julia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy rice and sugar. She dreams of having a wholesale outlet and owning her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Gladys Estela

texts.es: La señora Gladys Estela Sánchez García, tiene la edad de 26 años habita en el barrio el Rodeo, junto con sus padres, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder realizar sus sueños de ser enfermera, ella desde hace cinco años, se dedica a  la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que le afectan al cultivo ya que carecen de insumos, los planes hacia su cultivo es poder inducirlo bien y obtener mejores beneficios tanto económico, como para el cultivo . Ella inicio esta actividad con ayuda de su papá. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para obtener una buena producción y poder vender a buen precio.
texts.en:
Gladys Estela Sánchez García, 26, lives in the Rodeo neighborhood with her parents. The family plans are to improve living conditions and be able to follow her dreams of being a nurse. She has been farming for five years. The greatest difficulty is the pests that affect the crops because of lack of supplies. The plan for her farm is to be able to do well and gain better benefits both economically and for the farm. She started farming with her father’s help. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and the necessary supplies for a good production in order to be able to sell at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to improve her farm and get better production

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es:
Benigna es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Benigna es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Benigna tiene un puesto en el mercado de Santa Elena en donde vende verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Benigna necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tomate, zanahoria.
Los sueños de benigna son que su negocio crezca y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Benigna is a member of the Power Communal Bank group. She is 25 years old, has 2 children, and lives with her partner. Benigna works every day selling vegetables from a stall in the Santa Elena market.

She needs a loan of 900 soles to buy tomatoes and carrots. Benigna dreams of growing her business and finishing the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tomatoes and carrots

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
La señora Casilda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Azangaro, Provincia D. Azangaro, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 54 años D. edad, estado civil casada, es madre D. 12 hijos (2 ellos fallecidos, 8 ya casados y solo 02 a su cargo) y no tiene estudios,  vive en el Barrio Ezequiel Urbiola.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 02 años,  su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con el cual compró lanas para elaborar artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicita un préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder comprar lanas, y elaborar llicllas (mantas), frazadas, fajas, y todo lo que se le pida especialmente para matrimonios.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para poder solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas que dan en Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Casilda belongs to the 'Flor Azangarina II' Communal Bank which is located in the district of Azangaro, province of Azangaro, department of Puno. She is 54 years old, married, and mother of twelve children (2 deceased, 8 now married, and just two still in her care). She did not complete her education and lives in the Ezequirl Urbiola neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost two years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles with which she bought wool to create handmaD. items. Now she is seeking a loan of 1000 new soles to be able to buy wool and make capes, blankets, sashes, and all similar articles that are asked for, especially for wedding couples. Her greatest desire is to continue working so she can proviD. for the family expenses. She likes the savings and the talks provided by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of wools of various colors.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores es una mujer de 45 años, como esposa y madre de 2 hijos trata de brindar lo mejor de sí para mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia. Siempre le agradaron las tareas artesanales, como los bordados y la pintura y cuando se casó su pareja la animó a que aprendiera a realizar este tipo de labores. Con esta habilidad logró iniciar un negocio de elaboración y venta de cuadros y telas bordadas, artículos que confecciona en su casa todas las tardes para cumplir con los pedidos que entrega los fines de semana. Esta actividad la viene realizando formalmente desde hace 14 años, tiempo en el cual ha plasmado toda su creatividad en sus diversos trabajos, lo cual es valorado por sus clientes, quienes le pagan los precios adecuados según el esfuerzo realizado. Lo que más vende son sus telas bordadas, pues son más demandas por sus clientes. Dolores está ahorrando estas ganancias para poder obtener un puesto en un mercado de su localidad donde ofrezca los artículos que realiza. Ella se encuentra en su crédito número 21 con Microfinanzas PRISMA, lo cual fue posible por la conformación de su banco comunal que hasta el día de hoy trabaja con responsabilidad y sobre todo con principios cooperativos, lo cual mantiene en agrado a ella y todas sus compañeras. Con los 2800 soles que solicita comprará los materiales necesarios para sus cuadros (pintura) e hilos para sus bordados con los cuales espera incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Dolores is 45. As a wife and mother of two children she tries to give the best of herself to improve her family’s living conditions. Handicrafts like embroidery and painting have always appealed to her. When she got married her husband encouraged her to learn how to make this type of work. With this skill she was able to start a business of making and selling paintings and embroidered fabrics. She makes these articles in her house every afternoon to complete the orders she delivers on the week ends. She has been doing this for 14 years. In that time all of her creativity has materialized in her diverse works, which are valued by her customers. They pay a fair price based on the effort she has made. Her embroidered fabrics sell the most and are in the most demand. Dolores is saving her earnings to be able to get a stall in the local market where she can sell the articles that she makes. This is loan number 21 with Microfinanzas Prisma, which is made possible by the formation of her community bank. Her community bank still works responsibly and, above all, cooperatively. This pleases her and her colleagues. With the 2,800 PEN that she is asking for, she will buy the necessary materials for her paintings (paint). She will also buy thread for her embroidery, and she hopes to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her handicrafts

loans.name: United Grow Group

texts.en:
Kumba is a 40-year-old woman who has a small hardware stall at the local market.  There she sells locks, keys, door handles, and other things like that. 

Kumba has been in this business for 15 years, and in that time she has learned that in order to do well at your business, you need talk very nicely to your customers.   

 Kumba has 5 children that she is supporting – the oldest of whom is 20 and the youngest 5.  She dreams that with the profits that she will make from her business, she will be able to support her children through university and beyond.

loans.use: 2-3 dozen new locks, door knobs, and other hardware pieces.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La señora Ángela López C., tiene la edad de 58 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposo la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene cinco hijos , ya todos casado e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , doña Ángela desde hace 19 años , se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su hermana , los planes hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo.
texts.en:
Ángela López C., 58, lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood, which is located in the Concepción municipality. She lives with her husband, and she runs the household. They have five married and independent children. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. Ángela has been farming for 19 years. The biggest difficulty is the pests that affect the crops. She started farming with help from her sister. The plan for the farm is to be able to diversify. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Nelly Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Nelly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Vilcapaza.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de útiles de escritorio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, comprará cuadernos, fólders, lapiceros, engrampadores, grapas, chinches, etc, para su negocio.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gusta la responsabilidad que hay en su Banco Comunal y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Nelly belongs to the Flor Azangarina II Community Bank, which is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 53, married, and has three children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Vilcapaza neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy desk supplies. With this loan for 500 PEN, she will buy notebooks, folders, ballpoint pens, staplers, staples, and thumbtacks, etc. for her business. Her biggest wish is to keep working to pay the family expenses. She likes the community bank’s responsibility and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks, folders, ballpoint pens, staplers, staples, and thumbtacks, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Teresa es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Teresa vende materiales de construcción como ladrillos, agregados, en un local alquilado, además Teresa tiene carros con los cuales brinda servicios de transporte de agregados.
Teresa necesita un préstamo de 3200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arena y pago del personal.
Los sueños de Teresa son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio y comprar otro carro mas.
texts.en:
Teresa is member of the Carnations Communal Bank group. She is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. She sells building materials, such as bricks and cement, from a rented space. In addition, Teresa offers a delivery service and owns vehicles used for transporting cement.

Teresa needs 3200 soles so that she can purchase sand and pay her employees. She dreams of expanding her business, purchasing another vehicle, and having her children pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand and pay employees

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Zoila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo.  Ella tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (2do grado),  vive en el Barrio VilcA..

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  el cual utilizó para la compra de prendas de vestir (ropas). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de medias, buzos, chompitas, etc y también comprará ropa para adultos en todas las tallas como pantalones, blusas, buzos, medias, etc.

Su mayor sueño es poder implementar un taller metal mecánica para así poder trabajar con su hijo.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, y los pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Zoila belongs to the Flor Azangarina II Community Bank in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 41, and she is the single mother of one son. She completed her second year of high school. She lives in the VilcA. neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy clothes. She now needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy socks, track suits, and sweaters, etc. She will also buy all sizes of adult clothing like pants, blouses, track suits, and socks, etc. Her biggest dream is to be able to set up a metal works shop to be able to work with her son. She likes the savings and the punctual payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy socks, track suits, sweaters, pants, and blouses, etc.

loans.name: Aide

texts.es:
Aide es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Aide es casada, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Aide tiene un multiservicios en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, artículos de librería, bebidas, golosinas, ropa, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Aide brinda el servicio de preparación de comidas para diferentes eventos.
Aide necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra detergentes, jabones, bebidas y lapiceros.
Los sueños de Aide son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios profesionales, comprar una fotocopiadora y un carro.
texts.en:
Aide is a member of the community bank “Los Claveles”. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a business at her house selling groceries, office and school supplies items, beverages, candy and clothes; activity in which she works every day. Aide provides catering services, preparing meals for different events. Aide is asking for a loan of $350 that will be invested in the purchase of detergents, soaps, drinks and pens. Aide’s dreams are that her children finish their professional education and to buy a copy machine and a car.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Roberta es viuda, tiene 63 años y 7 hijos, Roberta tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Roberta se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo, productos que comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Roberta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bebidas y para el pago de peones.
Los sueños de Roberta son que su ultimo hijos culmine sus estudios y comprar un tractor agrícola.
texts.en:
Roberta is a member of the community bank “Los Claveles”. She is 63 years old, a widow and has 7 children. Roberta has a shop in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruits.

Roberta is dedicated to agriculture as well and has crops of corn and wheat, products that she sells at the city market. She is asking for a loan of $350 that will be invested buying soft drinks and paying workers. Roberta's dreams are that her youngest child will finish his education and that she will be able to buy a tractor.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital ( To buy soft drinks and pay workers )

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Maria López C. , tiene la edad de 52 años , habita en el barrio San Caralampio , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a sus hijos , ella es madre soltera , tiene cinco hijos tres ya casados e independiente , los dos estudian y le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , desde hace 16 años doña Maria se dedica a la agricultura , ella inicio esta actividad ya que fue apoyada por la reforma agraria , los planes hacia su finca es mejorar y diversificar el cultivo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos el cual aplicara al cultivo y lograr una buena cosecha y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de crédito y los plazos que le ha dado ya que ha mejorado su cultivo, y en lo personal ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Maria López C. is 52 years old and lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood in the town of Concepción. She is a single mother of five sons – three are married and live on their own, and the other two are students who help with the farm work. Mrs. Maria has been farming for 16 years, which she started as a result of land reform. Her plans include diversifying her crops and improving her harvest yields.

With this loan, she will purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies needed to ensure a harvest that brings in good prices at market. She thanks AFODENIC for giving her the opportunity to receive a loan, which has allowed her to make improvements around her farm and in her overall living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and farming supplies

loans.name: Las Ocho Abejitas Group

texts.es:
Grupo  Solidario: Las Ocho Abejitas                                    
Plazo del crédito: 8 catorcenas
Monto total         : $ 37.000.00
Desembolso 23 de Junio del 2009



 Grethel K.  Rodríguez :Ella  es una  mujer  de 38 años casada, emprendedora y responsable   originaria de Tierra Blanca  Veracruz, actualmente  ella representa  al grupo solidario  las  ocho abejitas, decidieron ponerle ese nombre al grupo ya que cuenta la señora  Grethel  que le gusta trabajar  en  grupo  como  las abejitas.

       La señora Grethel estudiaba  medicina , pero  al ver  que la solvencia económica  de  su familia  ya  no le alcazaba  para  sostener  sus  estudios,  opto por  dejar la carrera   y  así  buscar un trabajo para mejorar su calidad de  vida de Ella y su familia,   decidió   cursar  en una academia de belleza  y así  poner su propia  estética,  cuenta la señora Grethel  que este pequeño crédito  que FRAC  le brinda  lo utilizara  para comprar mas  artículos de belleza y así  brindar un mejor  servicio  y a su vez  mejorar  su trabajo.      

     Los  sueños de la señora Grethel,  es llegar  hacer una gran cultora de belleza,  reconocida  por todo el mundo, tener su establecimiento más  grande  y tener más  clientes,  a su vez  dar  cursos de belleza, para que otras personas  puedan incrementar sus  ingresos. Ya que dice llevar  19 años con su actividad, además que le gusta mucho este oficio, compartir todo su conocimiento a personas que de verdad se interesen   aprender,  dice tener mucha paciencia  para la enseñanza, comenta no había encontrado  una institución que  trabaje transparente  y  firme como  Fundacion  Realidad.

    Actualmente  el grupo esta  conformado por ocho mujeres,  emprendedoras y activas todas  cuentan  con una actividad  productiva.

    Este grupo se encuentra  en  su  primer  ciclo( primer crédito) están solicitando un crédito  de $37.000.00 con un  promedio  por cada integrante de $4,625.00,  ya que con este recurso  mejoraran en sus actividades productivas  y su calidad de  vida.

El grupo lo conforman:

Grethel K. Rodríguez: servicio de  belleza
Edith M. M.: servicio  de lavado de autos
Mercedes Rodríguez A.: venta de mercería
Mirna C. B.: venta de perfumería
Milka Rodríguez R.: venta de abarrotes
Lucina Terán P.: venta de piñatas y  manualidades
Alba Nidia Gutiérrez H.: servicio de renovadora de calzado
Lucia  Díaz Marín: venta de abarrotes
texts.en:
Communal bank: Las Ocho Abejitas Time period of the loan: 8 fortnights Total amount: 37.000.00 Mexican pesos Disbursal date: June 23, 2009 Grethel K. Rodríguez is a 38-year-old married woman. She is enterprising, responsible, and is a native of Tierra Blanca in Veracruz. She currently represents the communal bank, "Las ocho abejitas" (Eight Little Bees). They decided to name their group this because they like to work as a team like bees do. Grethel used to study medicine, but because of the economic situation of her family, she could no longer afford to study it, so she quit school to look for a job to improve her and her family's quality of life. She decided to go to a beauty academy to be able to start her own salon. She says she will use this small credit that FRAC is offering her to buy more beauty items so she can offer a better service and improve her work. Grethel's dream is to become an important beauty advisor and to be known around the world. She wants to have a big business, tohave more clients, and to give beauty classes so other people can increase their incomes. She has done this work for 19 years, and she really likes her work and sharing her knowledge with people who are truly interested in learning. She has a lot of patience for teaching. She has told us that she hasn't found another institution that works as hard and as transparently as Fundación Realidad. Currently this group is made up of eight enterprising and active women. Each of them has a productive job. This is the group's first loan, and they are requesting a credit of 37,000 pesos with an average loan of 4,625 pesos for each member. With this resource, they will improve their productivity and quality of life. The members of the group and their businesses are: Grethel K. Rodríguez: beauty service Edith M. M.: carwashing service Mercedes Rodríguez A.: merchandise sales Mirna C. B.: perfume sales Milka Rodríguez R.: grocery sales Lucina Terán P.: piñata and craft sales Alba Nidia Gutiérrez H.: shoe repair service Lucia Díaz Marín: grocery sales

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more beauty items to be able to provide better service and improve their work

loans.name: Elena Maria

texts.es:
La señora Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Ezequiel Urbiola.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de quesos, papa chuño, carne de ovino, etc. Para llevar a las ferias de la rinconada.

Su mayor deseo es darles una profesión a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas que dan en Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Elena belongs to the communal bank, "Flor Azangarina II," which is located in the district of Azangaro in the province of Azangaro, in the department of Puno. She is 32, married, and the mother of 3 children. She completed primary school and lives i nthe Ezequiel Urbiola neighborhood. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to purchase groceries. Now she needs a loan of 700 PEN to buy cheese, potatoes, flour, lamb, and other items to take to the markets in Rinconada. Her biggest dream is to see her children become professionals. She likes the savings and chats that she has with her communal bank through Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese, potatoes, flour, lamb, etc.

loans.name: Courtesy Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 36-year-old woman who managed to stay in school until 8th grade.  Mary has 4 children who all attend private school.  The oldest child is currently 13 and the youngest is 6.  She also cares for her sister’s child, who goes to school with her own.    

Mary supports the family through her dry goods stand in front of her house. In this shop she sells the necessities like rice, eggs, and pounded cassava.  Her primary method of attracting customers is by talking politely to them.    Mary dreams that her business will grow very large and she will be able to build or buy her own house.

loans.use: 2 or 3 bags of rice, 13 dozen eggs, 2 bags of sugar, and other things

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.es:
Cresenciana es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Cresenciana es soltera, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Cresenciana viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales variados, productos que comercializa en diferentes mercados de manera ambulatoria.
Cresenciana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada, maíz, trigo.
Los sueños de Cresenciana son mejorar su negocio y trabajar mas para sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Cresenciana is a partner of "Banco Comunal Los Claveles. She is single, 28 years old and has 1 son. Cresenciana travels to different regional markets where she buys a variety of cereals, which she sells as a street vendor at different markets. Cresenciana needs a loan of 1000 soles to be invested in buying barley, corn, and wheat. It is Cresenciana's dream to improve her business and work more to help her son get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barley, corn, and wheat.

loans.name: Miriam Herlinda

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Miriam tiene una tienda de repuestos en un local alquilado, mientras que su esposo tiene un taller mecánico en el mismo lugar y Miriam es quien le provee de repuestos.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos y lubricantes.
Los sueños de Miriam son implementar el taller de su esposo con todas las maquinarias y sus hijos estudien en buenos colegio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the Los Claveles (The Carnations) Communal Bank. She is living with her domestic partner, is 30 years old and has three children. Miriam has a parts store in a rented space, while her spouse has a mechanic's workshop in the same location and Miriam provides him with his parts. Miriam needs a loan of 1,600 Sols which will be used to buy parts and lubricants. Her dreams are to equip her husband's shop with all the necessary equipment, and that her children will study at a good high school.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Eliana Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Eliana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil Conviviente, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (2do grado),  vive en el Barrio Ezequiel Urbiola.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comidas al paso. 

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las charlas  y los encuentros de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Señora Eliana belongs to the communal bank, 'Flor Azangarina II," which is located in the district of Azangaro, in the province of Azangaro, in the deparment of Puno. She is 29, married, and has 3 children. She studied through her second year of secondary school and lives in the Ezequiel Urbiola neighborhood. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 1 year. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy supplies to make her meals she sells as a street vendor. Her biggest dream is to start a grocery store. She likes the savings, the chats, and the meetings she has at her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to make the meals she sells as a street vendor

loans.name: Yurem Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Zulmira Valquiria M. R., María José Gaitán V. y Martha Lorena F. H..

El grupo solidario Yurem está conformado por tres señoras originarias de Masaya, ellas tiene mucho tiempo de conocerse y tienen mucha confianza entre ellas.

Doña Johana es una joven de 24 años, soltera, madre de dos hijos de las edades tres y un año, con su trabajo ella mantiene a sus hijos, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa de forma ambulante.Ella sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casita, puesto que actualmente vive con su mamá, hacer que crezca su negocio, y darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
Con los créditos obtenidos ella expresa que ha podido capitalizarse y ha incrementado sus ventas. Es la coordinadora del grupo y anima a su grupo a ser puntual y cumplido con las cuotas.

María José Gaitán se dedica la venta de calzado variado, sandalias de mujer, zapatos de hombres y niños. Vende ambulante en Masaya y en el mercado, compra sus productos en los talleres de calzado donde ella consigue buenos precios cuando compra al por mayor. Con el crédito compró sandalias de mujer de varios estilos que están de moda. en los jóvenes, tiene muchos clientes, sus productos los vende al crédito y al contado, sueña con mejorar su casa dándole seguridad, tiene un hijo pequeño de dos años.

Doña Martha Lorena F. H. se dedica también a la venta de ropa y zapatos, combinando dos tipos de productos, ella inició vendiendo ropas pero con el tiempo los clientes también le solicitaron zapatos y sandalias. Ella es casada, madre de tres hijos de edades adolescentes y estudian en la escuela mas cercana a su vivienda, ella sueña con darles estudios secundarios y mejorar su casa.

 Este grupo está comprometido a pagar puntual y así seguir obteniendo créditos con Adim, están seguras que con el crédito saldrán adelante porque incrementan sus ventas y así sus ingresos.

Este grupo abona los días Lunes porque, se considera que es el mejor día para abonar, esto porque las ventas del fin de semana son las mejores.
texts.en:
In the photo from left to right: Zulmira Valquiria M. R., María José Gaitán V. y Martha Lorena F. H.. The Yurem Solidarity Group is made up of three women from Masaya. They have known each other for a long time and trust each other very much. Johana is a 24-year-old young woman who is single and the mother of two children who are three and one. She provides for her children through her work. She works at buying and selling clothes as a vendor. She dreams of buying land to build her own house, since she currently lives with her mother, and would like to grow her business and provide her children with a good education. With the loans obtained, she states that she has been able to capitalize and increase sales. She is the coordinator of the group and encourages the group to be punctual and to comply with payments. María José Gaitán works at selling various kinds of footwear, including women's sandals, men's and children's shoes. She sells as a vendor in Masaya and in the market. She buys her products in the shoemaker shops where she gets good prices when she buys them wholesale. With the loan, she bought women's sandals of various styles that are in fashion with the youth. She has many clients, and she sells her products by credit and cash. She dreams of improving her house to give her more security. She has a young son who is two. Martha Lorena F. H. also works at selling clothes and shoes, combining two types of products. She began selling clothes but over time her clients also requested shoes and sandals. She is married and a mother of three teenage children who study at a school near their home. She dreams of them finishing their secondary school studies and of improving her home. This group is committed to paying on time and thus continue to obtain loans with Adim. They are sure that with the loan they will be get ahead because they are increasing sales and therefore increasing their income. This group pays on Mondays because it is considered that it is the best day to pay because weekend sales are the best.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell by credit and cash

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hijo, Carmen vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Carmen trabaja en un restaurante como moza.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Carmen son tener un restaurante y que su hijo sean profesional.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Los Claveles Communal Bank. Carmen lives with her partner, is 20 years old and has one son. Carmen sells cosmetics through the catalogs that she provides her friends and family. Her sales are on credit. In addition, Carmen works in a restaurant as a waitress. Carmen needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics. Carmen's dream is to have a restaurant and that her son become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Frene Yasmina

texts.es:
Yasmina es socia del Banco Comunal El Trébol.
Yasmina es soltera, tiene 19 años y vive con sus padres, Yasmina vende ropa a pedido, que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Yasmina ayuda a su mama en la atención de su restaurante.
Yasmina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones.
Los sueños de Yasmina son tener un negocio grande y ser empresaria.
texts.en:
Yasmina is a member of the El Trébol Communal Bank. Yasmina is single 19-year-old and lives with her parents. Yasmina sells clothes upon request, which she offers to friends and family. Her sales are on credit. In addition, Yasmina helps her mom take care of her restaurant. Yasmina needs a loan of 900 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of polos and pants. Yasmina's dream is to become the owner of her own big business.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of polos and pants.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Modesta pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas D. Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Azangaro, Provincia D. Azangaro, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 89 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 02 hijos y no tiene estudios,  vive en el Barrio Revolución.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra D. abarrotes.
