Con este préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas, etc.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando, mientras tenga fuerzas.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, los encuentros del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Modesta belongs to the Las Poderosas D. Santa Rosa Community Bank, which is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 89, married, and she has two children. She did not go to school. She lives in the Revolución neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy groceries. With this loan for 1,000 PEN, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and canned goods, etc. Her wish is to keep working while she has the strength. She likes her community bank’s savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, milk, noodles, and canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 06 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Alianza. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de joyas para su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, comprará joyas, ganchos, carteras, etc, y otros artículos para fiestas y así aumentar su stock.

Su mayor sueño es poder abrir una tienda grande ya que ella cuenta con u mercadería bien surtida.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Jacinta belongs to the Flor Azangarina II Community Bank, which is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 45, in a common law marriage, and has six children. She has an elementary school education. She lives in the Alianza neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, and she used it to buy jewelry for her business. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy jewelry, hooks, and wallets, etc. She will also buy party items to increase her stock. Her biggest dream is to be open a large store because she is well supplied with merchandise. She likes her community bank’s savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hooks, and wallets, etc.  Also buy party items.

loans.name: Truthful Group

texts.en:
Wilhemina is a 37-year-old woman who runs a dry goods shop out of her house.  Wilhemina has been running this business for 2 years and has plans to grow her business to having a shop outside and hopefully one day being an international company.  

The loan she is requesting will help her to restock her store.  She wants to buy additional soap, candles, and sardines particularly.   

 Wilhemina was only able to complete school up to the junior level before she had to stop.  Now Wilhemina has 3 children of her own whom she is able to send to school.  Her oldest child is 17, her second oldest is 10, and her youngest is 4.  She also cares for 4 other children who are not her own.  One is her husband's child, one is her brother-in-law’s child, one is her nephew, and the other is her granddaughter.

loans.use: Sardines, soap, candles, and other items that need restocking

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: Anabel tiene 29 años, vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos. Se dedica a atender su propio consultorio dental todos los días de la semana de acuerdo a los horarios de visita de sus clientes, que por lo general son hasta los domingos en las tardes y sólo descansa los martes de cada semana. Realiza extracciones de dientes, curaciones diversas y otros tratamientos dentales y lo hace con mucho profesionalismo por lo que sus clientes van en aumento. Anabel está muy entusiasmada por la labor que está realizando y planea seguir con este proyecto profesional hasta tener una clínica odontológica. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de ser parte del banco comunal que integra y renueva su compromiso de seguir adelante con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de materiales odontológicos que necesita para su consultorio.
texts.en:
Anabel, 29, lives with her parents in their house. She works in her own dental office every day of the week according to the schedule for seeing patients. Generally she is open until Sunday afternoons. Her only day off is every Tuesday. She extracts teeth, cures diverse problems, and performs other dental treatments. Because she does so very professionally, the number of patients she has is increasing. Anabel is very enthusiastic about the work she is doing, and she plans to continue on this professional path until she has her own dental clinic. This is the third time she has had a loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of her community bank. She renews her promise to continue on very responsibly. The money she is asking for will be used to buy dental materials that she needs for her office.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dental materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: White Teeth And Black Hearts Group

texts.en:
Watta is a 20-year-old business woman who has a stand in one of the large markets in Liberia.  Watta has a business selling “small, small things,” which means a small stand carrying some variety of small spicy peppers, onions, garlic, small bags of spices, salt, cans of tomato paste, bottles of vegetable oil, bottles of palm oil, etc.  She has been doing this business for 3 years.    

Watta has one children who is now 2 years old.  The child goes to day care while Watta is at work.     Watta says that her business is successful because of the way that she talks to people.  She is able to attract people to come to her stand by making friends in the market place.  She hopes that because of this good strategy, her business will expand, and that because of this expansion her brothers and sisters will be able to go to college.     

Today, Watta is getting a loan to introduce clothing sales into her business.  She believes that this business will be more profitable.

loans.use: To buy clothes to start a clothing business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 49 años, vive solo en una casa alquilada. Se dedica a brindar el servicio de peinados y cortes de cabello desde hace más de 32 años, pues hace 15 años decidió abrir su propio salón de belleza en una zona muy céntrica de su ciudad. Y a la calidad de sus servicios ha aumentado considerablemente su clientela. Carlos trabaja con una persona que contrata para que lo ayude a abastecerse con la atención de todos sus clientes. Para un futuro cercano, Carlos desea convertir su salón de belleza y peluquería en un Spa donde pueda brindar servicios adicionales. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, él es uno de los integrantes de su banco comunal que promueve la unidad y la responsabilidad en su grupo y su deseo es continuar con este mismo trabajo. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará un equipo de manicure, un sillón de tratamiento facial y una tina para pedicure.
texts.en:
Carlos, 49, lives alone in a rented house. He has been styling and cutting hair for more than 32 years. Fifteen years ago he decided to open his own beauty salon in a central zone in his city. The number of his customers has increased considerably because of his quality services. Carlos works with another person who he has hired to help him provide services to all of his customers. In the near future, Carlos wants to convert his beauty salon into a Spa where he could offer additional services. This is his third loan with MFP. He is one of the members of his community bank who promotes unity and responsibility, and he wishes to continue with this same work. With the money he is asking for he will buy manicure equipment, a chair for facial treatment, and a tub for pedicures.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy equipment for his beauty salon

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: United Club 5 Group

texts.en:
Wahr is a 32-year-old man who was only able to get to 10th grade in school.  Together with his wife, he now has 3 children: one who is 6, one who is 5, and the baby who is 1.  His older children are in a local private school.   

 Wahr has a business renting out wheelbarrows for people to use to sell their goods.  In Liberia, it is very common for people to fill a wheelbarrow with goods and walk around trying to sell them.  The types of goods you might find in the wheelbarrow are fruits, hair pieces, sweets, spices, and other small things.  

  Renting a wheelbarrow from Wahr costs 200 LD per day – and he has 30 “wheels” that he rents each day.  He has been running this business for 4 years, and he is always trying to increase the number of “wheels” he has for rent.  With the loan he is requesting now he will be able to purchase new “wheels!”  He says the price changes often so he is not sure how many yet!

loans.use: New Wheelbarrows to rent out

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 44 años, es viuda, vive con sus 2 hijas de 19 y 15 años en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y en ocasiones va acompañada de sus hijas en las largas caminatas que realiza diariamente para ofrecer sus productos y realizar sus cobranzas. Adicionalmente, por las tardes vende comida en una de las esquinas de su casa, pero la actividad que le resulta más rentable es la venta de cosméticos y prendas de vestir que reparte de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes y cobra según los acuerdos pactados. Para un futuro  cercano, Carmen planea establecerse en un puesto de ventas mostrando sus catálogos y ofreciendo sus productos a las personas que transiten por allí. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y disfruta mucho del trabajo que realiza en su banco comunal porque es un espacio de solidaridad y amistad. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de más mercadería en cosméticos y prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Carmen, 44, is a widow. She lives with her 19 year old daughter and her 15 year old daughter in her parents’ house. She has been selling cosmetics for one year. Sometimes her daughters go with her on her long, daily walks to sell products and collect her payments. In the afternoons she also sells food on one of the corners by her house. But, her most profitable activity is cosmetic and clothing sales. She delivers these items according to her customers’ orders, and she charges the agreed upon price. In the near future Carmen plans to set up a sales place to display her catalogs and offer her products to the people who pass by. This is her third loan with MFP. She really enjoys the work she does with her community bank because of the support and friendship. The money she is asking for is to buy more cosmetic and clothing merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 47 años, vive con sus 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 16 años en la casa de su abuela. Desde hace más de 15 años se dedica a la venta de chicharrones (plato a base de carne de cerdo frita) en un puesto que tiene en una calle bien transitada de su ciudad desde la tarde hasta que llega la noche. De esa manera ella y sus hijos venden esta comida típica de su zona y debido a su buena sazón y calidad en su preparación ha adquirido muchos clientes estables que siempre consumen su platillo, por lo que es rentable su negocio. Carmen está planeando implementar en un local  para que se convierta en un restaurante. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las personas que siempre  recuerda a sus compañeros de banco comunal sobre la importancia de trabajar en unidad y en equipo. Ahora que está nuevamente solicitando este crédito se compromete a seguir trabajando  con los mismos ideales de éxito. El dinero que está solicitando será para que adquiera nuevos cubiertos para la atención de sus clientes, así como para la compra de una cocina nueva.
texts.en:
Carmen is 47. She lives with her three children; ages 20, 18, and 16, in her grandmother’s house. For over 15 years she has been selling “chicharrones” (a dish made from fried pork) in a stand that she has on a well traveled street in her city. She and her children sell this food that is typical to her zone from the afternoon until night time. Because of her good seasoning and the quality of preparation, she has acquired many stable customers who always eat her dishes. Her business is profitable. Carmen is planning to set up a place that she can convert into a restaurant. This is her third loan with MFP. She is one of the people who always reminds her colleagues in her community bank about the importance of being united and working together as a team. Now that she is asking for this loan, she promises to keep working with the same ideals of success. The money she is asking for is to get new cutlery for her customers and to buy a new stove.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a stove and utensils for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hirma

texts.es: Hirma tiene 37 años, es viuda, vive en casa alquilada con sus 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 7 años de edad. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de frutas de acuerdo a la temporada. Dotada de un triciclo para el transporte de su mercadería, todos los días por las mañanas se establece en una de las esquinas de la calle principal de su ciudad, además no sólo vende frutas, sino que también prepara jugos. Por el momento realiza este trabajo sola, pero cuando sus hijos están de vacaciones la apoyan con las ventas. Gracias a este negocio Hirma puede seguir sosteniendo la economía de su hogar, ya que las ganancias son rentables. Para un futuro cercano desea tener un local para evitar moviéndose de su lugar cada vez que los policías municipales se lo ordenan porque no cuenta con una licencia. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es considerada una integrante muy colaboradora y responsable en su banco comunal y su parte, se compromete a seguir cultivando esta actitud positiva. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de frutas al por mayor, las comprará en otra ciudad donde le venden a precios más bajos, por lo que tiene que costear no sólo la inversión en al compra de la mercadería, sino también el transporte.
texts.en:
Hirma is 37 years old, widowed, and lives in a rented house with her 3 children (ages 17, 15, and 7). For 8 years she has been in the business of selling seasonal fruits. Equipped with a tricycle, she transports her goods each morning to her vending location at one of the main street corners in the city. In addition to fruit, she also prepares juices for sale. She usually works alone, but her children help with the business during the holidays. Thanks to the profits she has earned, Hirma is able to maintain her household. In the future, she hopes to have a stable vending location because the municipal police order her to move because she does not have a license.

This is her third loan with MFP. Hirma is considered an integral and very responsible communal bank member, always encouraging a positive attitude within her group. The money she is requesting will be used to buy fruit wholesale in another city where prices are lower. In addition, the loan will be used to cover the cost of transporting her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit wholesale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Faithful Women Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a 48-year-old woman.  She never went to school because she grew up deep in the interior of Liberia.    Sarah has 4 children that she raised until they were so big they left the house and 2 children that she is still working on raising in her home.  All of her children were able to attend school (unlike her) and she made sure to send them to private school so that they could have a quality education.   

 Sarah’s business is selling plastic dishes in the market.  She has been doing this for 4 years.  She says that she attracts customers by talking sweet to them and making them laugh.  She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can support the rest of her children through school.    

With the loan she is requesting, she will be able to restock her dishes.  Because the currency is ever changing, Sarah does not have a specfic number of containers of dishes that she plans to buy.  She hopes that the money will stretch to allow her to purchase 13-20 dozen.

loans.use: 13-20 dozen new sets of dishes for resale

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline tiene 22 años, tiene un bebé de 3 meses y vive junto a su abuela en la casa de ella. Desde hace 3 años y medio se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, para ello sale todos los días a ofrecer sus productos a través de catálogos y muestrarios para dar mayor confianza a sus clientes. Cuando va a estudiar a la universidad sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de clases, de esta manera se genera los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades de su pequeño hijo. Debido a su habilidad para las ventas ha conseguido, con esfuerzo y empeño, obtener nuevos clientes, logrando superar sus ganancias anteriores, lo cual la anima mucho para seguir trabajando de esta manera. Además, esta actividad le permite seguir estudiando y cuidar de su bebé. Para un futuro, Jackeline quiere establecerse en un local comercial donde pueda vender sus productos. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está decidida a seguir trabajando solidariamente en su banco comunal, donde se siente respaldada por sus compañeros. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a la compra de mercadería en productos de belleza para incrementar su stock y poder vender de forma inmediata cuando se lo soliciten, sin hacer el pedido por catálogo.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 22 years old. She has a 3 month old baby and lives with her grandmother. She has been selling cosmetics for 3½ years. Her merchandise is sold through catalogs, and she provides samples to her customers so that they will gain confidence in the products. Her main clients are her classmates at the college where she studies. The revenue generated from her business has helped satisfy the needs of her young child. Jackeline’s effort and commitment are reflected in her sales results, her ability to gain new customers, and her increased income from previous years. She is encouraged to continue with her hard work. Her business enables her to continue studying and taking care of her baby. In the future, Jackeline wants to have her own shop where she can sell her products.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is determined to continue working with her communal bank, where she is supported by her peers. The money she is requesting will be used to increase her stock of beauty products so that she can sell them immediately upon request without ordering from a catalog.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of beauty products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 43 años, vive con su hijo de 14 años en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de medicinas y prendas de vestir, ella aprovecha en realizar sus ventas en un consultorio médico donde trabaja como asistente, allí vende las medicinas aprovechando las recetas que les dan a los pacientes. Y los fines de semana vende sus prendas de vestir de casa en casa visitando a sus amistades, vecinos y familiares. Hasta el momento estas actividades le han resultado muy rentables por lo que Liliana se anima a planificar el futuro de su negocio con el incremento de mercadería. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy comprometida con el trabajo que se está realizando en su banco comunal y asume uno de los cargos de la junta directiva. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado para la compra de más medicinas y prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Liliana is 43 years old and lives in a rented house with her 14 year old son. She has been selling medicines and clothing for 9 years. While at her job as an assistant in a medical office, she sells prescription medication to patients. On the weekends, she travels house to house -- selling clothing to friends, neighbors, and relatives. So far these efforts have proved very profitable and have encouraged Liliana to plan for the future of her business by increasing her stock of merchandise.

This is her third loan with MFP. She is strongly committed to the work of her communal bank and holds a position on the board of directors. The money she is requesting will be used to buy more medicines and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more medicines and clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 44 años, vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos. Ella es abogada de profesión y hace 10 años decidió abrir su propio estudio jurídico donde también vende cosméticos a sus colegas y clientes. Vende por catalogo y en ocasiones también ofrece prendas de vestir. Norma se siente satisfecha por las actividades que realiza, ya que con las ganancias puede solventar sus gastos. Además está muy contenta de poder ejercer su profesión, ya que es muy difícil, ella misma conoce a personas que han estudiado la misma carrera pero se dedican a otras actividades debido a su situación económica, pero ella con mucho esfuerzo y profesionalismo ha logrado la estabilidad de su estudio y la venta de cosméticos y ropa son ganancias adicionales que no quiere dejar de lado. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal donde se compromete nuevamente a seguir impulsando un trabajo coordinado dentro del grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de mercadería en cosméticos y ropa que le han solicitado recientemente.
texts.en:
Norma, 44, lives with her parents in their house. She is a lawyer by profession. Ten years ago she decided to open her own legal office where she also sells cosmetics to her colleagues and clients. She sells by catalog, and on occasion she also sells clothes. Norma feels satisfied with the activities she does because she can pay her expenses. She is also happy to be able to exercise her profession because it is very difficult. She knows people who have studied the same career, but they do other things because of their economic situation. With much effort and professionalism she has achieved stability in her office. The cosmetic and clothing sales are additional earnings that she does not want to leave aside. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to belong to her community bank, where she promises to continue encouraging coordinated work within her group. The money she is asking for will be used to buy cosmetics and clothes that have been recently requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 51 años, vive con sus dos hijos de 26 y 24 años en la casa de unos familiares. Desde hace 25 años se dedica a la venta de periódicos en un puesto que tiene ubicado en una zona céntrica de su ciudad. Sus principales clientes son los choferes de las empresas de transporte, ya que está ubicada cerca de los paraderos para pasajeros. Olga adquiere sus periódicos y revistas durante la madrugada para que todas las mañanas, muy temprano ya esté ofreciendo sus diarios, permaneciendo en su puesto hasta el medio día. Esta forma de trabajo le ha dado buenos resultados y obtiene ganancias que le permiten sostener su casa. Para el futuro, Olga se  proyecta en adquirir otros puestos de venta de periódicos y empezar a ofrecer libros. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella se siente muy satisfecha de formar parte de su banco comunal donde reina la confianza, además renueva su compromiso de seguir trabajando responsablemente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más libros y revistas de interés de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Olga is 51 years old and lives in her relatives’ house, with her two sons who are 26 and 24 years old. She has been selling newspapers for the last 25 years in a booth that is located downtown. Her main customers are the drivers of transportation companies and the passengers, since the booth is located near the bus stop. Olga buys the newspapers and magazines very early in the morning and remains at the booth until noon.

The business has had good results and profits that help her to provide for her household. Olga plans to buy some more booths and start to offer books. This is her third loan with MFP. She feels very happy to be part of her community bank where there is trust and renews her commitment to continue to work responsibly. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more books and magazines that are of the interest of her customers

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Business ownership has been a gateway to personal freedom for Pedro. He has worked many jobs in his lifetime, but none other has given him the satisfaction that running his taxi service does. Pedro operates his taxi in Manhattan from 42nd Street and below, driving clients all over New York City, to and from the airports, and sometimes long distances to other cities along the eastern seaboard. He has been married for 30 years, has a grown daughter, and is also a proud grandfather.

The dispatch company for which Pedro operates his taxi requires him to purchase a new vehicle every ten years. Pedro currently drives a 1998 with more than 397,000 miles, so he has come to ACCION USA for a loan to purchase a new vehicle. In addition to allowing him to continue working for his current dispatch company, the new taxi will provide a more comfortable ride for his clients. Pedro is a long-time client of ACCION USA. He has received several loans in the past and has always repaid on time.

He has plans to rent his old taxi to a cousin who can use it with another dispatch service in New York City. Pedro is looking forward to the next ten years with his new taxi. He is thankful to be supported and able to live out his dream of owning a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a newer taxi

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
In 2006, Mrs. Feliciana B., 54, set up her food business. She sells food on the streets and viands for lunch, especially to people who don't have time to cook food. All the income that she earns from selling food helps in paying off the utility bills and in meeting the basic needs of her family.

She is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI to buy additional ingredients for food vending. She has been thinking of starting some other business to supplement her income. The loan will truly help her grow her business.

Like other entrepreneurs, she is thankful to CEVI for helping her. According to her, the loan that she gets from joining the program of CEVI has strengthened her business. Every week during meetings, she learns different things from other entrepreneurs. CEVI provides its clients not only loans, but also trainings and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca S. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 47 years old. Rebecca is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks for her store . This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rebecca from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Risafe

texts.en:
Risafe V. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 26 years old. Lucy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Risafe owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motor cab for hire services to the local community. Risafe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Risafe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Risafe successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase spare parts for maintenance. Risafe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for motor cab repair to provide service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Risafe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Motor cab repair

loans.name: Mrs. Bunthy Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people living in Thma Kor village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Bunthy S. is the 50- year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to grow mangoes. Now she has an obstacle because her field is infertile and has suffered insect damage. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to enable her mangoe production to be better. She hopes to increase her income and production. Her husband, Mr. Nouv Sam Oul, is a teacher in the local school. They have a child who is employed in a garment factory. All of them are presented in the picture but some of them are blocked.

Six members in this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. The members with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her mango farm

loans.name: Mr. Vanseng Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of fourteen members, is located in Thma Kor village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Vanseng S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land near his house which he uses grow vegetables and fruits. Now he is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to support his growing. His wife, Mrs. S. SaR., makes Chinese noodles to earn an income to support the family.

Mr. Vanseng S. is the 59-year-old father of eight childR.: three are laborers; another is a seller who helps his mother’s business; three are enrolled in the local school; and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Four members in this group loans are end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT  loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide to support his farm

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mr. Phally Y. is a villager in Preak Svay Village in Kandal Province and he is a fisherman. In this business, he faces a small problem because he does not have enough fishing equipment. So he decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing tools for his business.

His wife, Mrs. Channa Keo, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land near her house. This couple has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another three are attending the local school and the youngest one is just 1 year old. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools for his fishing business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma M. is 41 years old, married with four children, and presently resides at Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Her loan is intended to buy vitamins and feed for her livestock.

Vilma has been a member of Paglaum MPC since September 2005 and she admitted that, with the help of PMPC Microfinance, her business has grown in such a way that she has a better income now than before. She hopes to have a comfortable life someday, be able to send her children to school, and to have a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Mercury

texts.en:
Mercury G. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old. Mercury is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercury owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling charcoal. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling charcoal products in the local community. Mercury has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mercury joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercury is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional charcoal to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mercury from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell

location.town: Sto. ñino, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.en:
Ponciano C. is from the village of Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old. Ponciano is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Ponciano owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Ponciano has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ponciano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ponciano has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Ponciano is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ponciano from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Ni Komang Martini

texts.en:
Ni Komang Martini (DNR.M-0570) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Brawantangi, Melaya. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Ni Komang Martini owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Komang Martini has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 250,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Komang Martini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Komang Martini has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Ni Komang Martini is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase livestock, feed, and other supplies. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Komang Martini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock, feed, and other supplies

loans.name: Cirenia

texts.en: Cirenia E. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married, and has five adult children. Cirenia owns and operates a hog-fattening business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Cirenia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cirenia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feeds and other supplies. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en:
Mr. Sarann M. is 47 years old and lives in Kandal Leu village in Kandal province. He owns a small business that sells glue to repair leaking boats. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more glue to resell so as to earn more profits.

His wife, Mrs. Mouk Samey, is a housewife who takes care of her babies. This couple has seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, another is an electrician, three are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more glue to resell to earn more profits

loans.name: Sayu Putu Murdani

texts.en: Sayu Putu Murdani (DNR.M-0571) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Brawantangi, Melaya. She is married and has two adult children. Sayu Putu Murdani owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 1,000,000 IDR a month. In 2007, Sayu Putu Murdani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional animals. Sayu Putu Murdani is now requesting a new loan of 5,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 4th from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Sayu Putu Murdani - (DNR.M-0571) merupakan 45 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Brawantangi - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, Sayu Putu Murdani memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Sayu Putu Murdani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 6 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Sayu Putu Murdani menghasilkan sekitar 1,000,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2007, Sayu Putu Murdani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Sayu Putu Murdani meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli hewan tambahan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,400,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli ternak indukan. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Sayu Putu Murdani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk tabungan sebagai cadangan bagi keadaan darurat di masa mendatang. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Ni Wayan Suarmi

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Suarmi (DNR.M-0572) is a 56-year-old married mother of four adult-aged children living in the town of Brawantangi - Melaya. To making a living, Ni wayan Suarmi aised livestock. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni wayan Suarmi has been engaged in this business for over eight years, earning approximately 1,000,000 IDR a month.

In 2007, Ni wayan Suarmi joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 3,500,000 IDR from DINARI that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise, she is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her fourth from DINARI, and Ni wayan Suarmi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
