loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Liesel

texts.en: Liesel G. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married, and has one infant child. Liesel owns and operates a business providing motor cab transport to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Liesel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma P. is a food vendor who sells a variety of foods in the streets to earn a living for her family. She sells "balut," a delicacy made from chicken or duck eggs which is popular as street food in the Philippines. Its taste is very distinct. Some say that a tour of the Philippines is not complete if a tourist does not sample it.

Gemma would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI to buy more eggs to make balut for sale. The loan will go far in improving her business. The income that she gets from her business helps her feed and educate her children.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides its clients not just with loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy eggs for making balut for sale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca B. is from the village of Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has six adult children. Francisca owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling daily-use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Francisca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rosalinia

texts.en: Rosalinia D. is from the village of Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, married, and has four adult children. Rosalinia owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling specialty food products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2005, Rosalinia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Rosalinia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Shahnoz

texts.ru: Шахноз – молодая женщина 27 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается продажей детской одежды и женской обуви на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Так как ее муж не очень хорошо зарабатывает, она старается много работать и зарабатывать побольше денег, чтобы прокормить семью. Конечно же ей очень трудно. Шахноз закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан.  Шахноз хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Shahnoz is a 27-year old mother of three. She is married. She has a high school diploma and makes a living by purchasing children's clothing and women's shoes at Istaravshan's wholesale market and selling them at the Farovon market of Gafurov town. Since her husband does not earn much, Shahnoz works hard in order to provide for her family. This is certainly not easy. In order to expand her assortment and attract more customers, Shahnoz has applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: children's clothing and women's shoes

loans.name: Tuhfaniso

texts.ru: Тухфанисо – 51 год. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Она занимается продажей разных тканей для национальных платьев.  Она торгует на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова. Тухфанисо закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан, и часть товара в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром  2 раза в город Истаравшан и 1 раз в месяц в город Бишкек. Тухфанисо за свой кредит хочет закупить партию летней ткани штапель.
texts.en:
Tuhfaniso is 51-years old and she is married with two children. She sells fabric for national costumes. She works at Gafurov's Farovon market. Tuhfaniso buys goods at Istaravshan's wholesale market and in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. Twice a month she travels to Istaravshan and once a month to Bishkek. She would like to use the loan for the purchase of new fabric for the summer season.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabric retail

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania P. is engaged in a food vending business. She is 51 years old this year and has two children.

Melania cooks and earns reasonable profit from what she sells to the neighborhood. In addition to food, she also raises pigs. The income that she gets from her business is what she uses to buy the basic needs of the family as well as for house repair.

Knowing the various services of Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), she requests a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients for her food business.

CEVI helps her to better sustain her livelihood. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Izatbibi

texts.ru: Изатбиби – женщина 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Её муж разнорабочий. Зарабатывает не так уж хорошо. Изатбиби занимается продажей сладостей и кондитерских изделий на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Кондитерские изделия ей поставляет разные фирмы а также домашние кондитеры. Изатбиби старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать импортные конфеты и сладости, для расширения своего ассортимента. Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход.
texts.en:
Izatbibi is a 48-year old mother of three. Her husband works day jobs and does not earn much. Izatbibi sells sweets at Gafurov's Farovon market. She purchases the sweets both from companies and private suppliers. Izatbibi would like to expand the variety of sweets in her shop by offering imported sweets. This would help her increase her family's income.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: imported sweets

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita C. is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Nenita operates a family member's business operating a specialized retail store, primarily selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2005, Nenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 18th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hayriniso

texts.ru: Хайринисо – 49 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Она занимается продажей детского и женского нижнего белья. Она торгует на втором этаже рынка «Чоршанбе» города Худжанда, а также на "Джумабазаре" и "Якшанбебазаре" города Худжанда. Хайринисо закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан и часть товара из города Бишкек Республики Киргизстан. Она ездит за товаром 2-3 раза в месяц. Хайринисо кредитуется у нас с 2004 года. Она очень прилежный клиент. Хайринисо просит кредит для закупки новой партии летнего женского и детского белья их хлопчатобумажной ткани. Тогда у Хайринисо увеличится ассортимент ее товара.
texts.en:
Hayriniso is a 49-year old mother of four. She is married. She sells children's and women's underwear on the first floor of Hojannd's Chorshanbe market as well as at Hojand's Jumabazar and Yakshanbebazar markets. Two or three times a month Hayriniso travels to Istaravshan's wholesale market or Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan to purchase goods. Hayriniso has been our client since 2004, and she has always been an excellent client. This time she is applying for a loan in order to purchase women's and children's cotton underwear for the summer season. This would allow Hayriniso increasing the variety of goods she sells.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: women's and children's underwear

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат – женщина 44 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается продажей детской одежды, а также мужского нижнего белья на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Ее муж работает разнорабочим, в свободное время помогает жене в ее бизнесе. Они старается много работать и зарабатывать побольше денег, чтобы прокормить семью. Инобат закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Она сама ездит выбирать товар. Инобат хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для закупки летнего товара.
texts.en:
Inobat is a 44-year old mother of two. She is married and has a high school diploma. She sells children's clothes and men's underwear at Favoron market in Gafurov. Inobat's husband works day jobs, and spends his free time helping Inobat. The couple works hard in order to provide for their family. Inobat travels to Istaravshan to purchase goods at the wholesale market. She knows that a good assortment of goods attracts more clients, and she would like to improve the variety of goods she sells. In order to offer more summer clothes at her stall, Inobat is applying for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: children's summer clothes

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina S. is from the village of Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Rosalina owns and operates a service-based business, primarily providing chainsaw-cutting services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair the chainsaw used for the business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the chainsaw used for the business

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Шухрат мужчина 26 лет. Женат и отец 4-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Шухрат занимается откормом и продажей скота со своим отцом. Шухраи с юности помогал отцу ухаживать за домашнем скотом. У Шухрата есть стадо мелко рогатого скота, примерно 15 овец, 5 коз и 4 коровы. Свой скот Шавкат реализует у мясников. Шавкат очень признателен нашей организации хочет в дальнейшем развиваться.
texts.en:
Shuhrat is a 26-year old father of four. His wife is a homemaker, and she also tends to the cattle that Shuhrat raises and sells, together with this father. Ever since Shuhrat was young, he has helped his father raise cattle. Now he has around fifteen sheep, five goats, and four cows. Shuhrat sells the cattle to butchers. He is grateful to our organization and wants to develop further. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат – 51 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Она занимается продажей дорогих национальных тканей.  Она торгует на рынке Бунафша находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. В пятницу она выходит на рынок «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Адолат закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан, и часть товара в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром  2 раза в город Истаравшан и 1 раз в месяц в город Бишкек. Адолат за свой кредит хочет закупить партию летней дорогой ткани шифон для национальных платьев.
texts.en:
Adolat is a 51-year old mother of four. She is married. Adolat makes a living by selling expensive fabric that is used for making national costumes. She sells at the Bunavsha market, which is located in the Panchshanbe neighborhood of Hojand. She sells at Juma-bazaar on Fridays, and at Yakshanbe bazaar on Sundays. Twice a month Adolat travels to the wholesale market of Istaravshan and once a month to Bishkek. She would like to use the loan for the purchase of chiffon for national dresses for the summer season.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expensive fabric for traditional dresses

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуде - 42 года. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Занимается продажей женской одежды на рынке "Сомонбазар" города Худжанда, контейнер 087. Она привозит товар из города Алма-аты Республики Казахстан. Иногда ездит в город Бишкек. И два раза в месяц ездит в город Истаравшан. Мавлуда уже один год кредитуется в нашей организации. За этот период она показала себя как опытный бизнесмен и своевременно погашает свой займ. Мавлуда просит займ для закупки летней партии женской одежды.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a 42-year old mother of two. She is married. She sells women's clothing at Hojand's Somonbazaar market (container 087). She brings goods from Alma-Aty, Kazakhstan. Twice a month she travels to Istaravshan, and sometimes to Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. Mavluda has been our client for a year, and she has been noted for her business experience and the timeliness of repayment. Mavluda is applying for a loan in order to purchase women's summer clothes.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: women's summer clothes

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мукадас женщина 36 лет. Замужем имеет 3-х детей. Мукадас занимается продажей продуктов и питание. Раньше она отдавала часть магазина своей знакомой, а в настоящий момент её товар увеличился и её подруга вынуждена была найти другой магазин. А Мукадас прикупила ещё больше товаров, что и привело к увеличению потребителей, и поэтому её дочь помогает для продажей продуктов. Её муж дополнительно работает таксистом.Также она хочет увеличить свою прибыль для семейного положения сделать ремонт.
texts.en:
Mukadas is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. She is involved in sales of food products. Previously, she leased part of her store to her friend, but since her product expanded, her friend had to find another store. Meanwhile, Mukadas added more products, which resulted in more customers. This is why her daughter now helps her with the sales. Mukadas’s husband works as a taxi driver. She wants to increase her profit and, to improve her family conditions, wants to make repairs.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille D. runs a sari-sari or general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc. in the local community. She is 26 years old, married and has one infant child. She is from the village of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Cecille has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cecille joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Cecille is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zamirahon

texts.ru: Замирахон – 37 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей детской одежды. Она торгует на рынка «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда, а также по пятницам на рынке "Джумабазар" и по воскресеньям на рынке "Якшанбебазар" города Худжанда. Замирахон закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан и часть товара из города Бишкек Республики Киргизстан. Она ездит за товаром 2-3 раза в месяц. Замирахон кредитуется у нас с 2005 года. Она очень хороший клиент. Замирахон просит кредит для закупки новой партии летнего детской одежды их хлопчатобумажной ткани. Тогда у Замирахон увеличится ассортимент ее товара.
texts.en:
Zamirahon is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells children’s clothing. She sells at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand, at the Djumabazar market on Fridays and at the Yakshanbebazar in the city of Khujand on Sundays. Zamirahon buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan and some merchandise in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyzstan Republic. She travels there 2-3 times per month. Zamirahon has been our client since 2005. She is a very good client. Zamirahon is requesting this loan in order to buy a new stock of children’s summer clothing made from cotton fabric. Then, Zamirahon’s merchandise assortment will increase.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer children's clothing

loans.name: Geneveth

texts.en:
Geneveth V. is 29 years old, married with one child, and presently resides at Taguima, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

Geneveth, with the help of her husband, is engaged in a barbecue and snack-vending business. She needs additional capital to purchase ingredients in order to meet the demands of her customers, mostly students of a nearby school. So she applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 9,000. She plans to have a concrete store with enough capital and to have a decent house, too.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her barbecue and snack-vending business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Hardworking and industrious, Norma P. is 66 years old, married with one child, and presently lives at Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Norma joined Paglaum in April 2008 to secure financial assistance for her sari-sari store to buy additional stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks and other household items. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store and have her child finish a college degree and have a good future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Hermilita

texts.en: Hermilita C. is from the village of Corales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married, and has two adult children. Hermilita works in a family member's business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Hermilita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Hermilita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора - молодая девушка, ей 22 года. Не замужем. Занимается продажей женской одежды на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова. Ей привозят товар из города Бишкека Республики Кыргизии. Иногда она сама ездит в город Бишкек. И два раза в месяц ездит в город Истаравшан. Гулнора с 2004 года кредитуется в нашей организации. За этот период она показала себя только с хорошей стороны и своевременно погашает свой займ. Гулнора просит займ для закупки летней партии женской одежды.
texts.en:
Gulnora is a young, 22-year-old woman. She is single. Gulnora sells women’s clothing at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. Her merchandise is delivered from the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyzstan Republic. Sometimes, she travels there herself too. She also travels for the merchandise to the city of Istaravshan twice per month. Gulnora has been our client since 2004. Since then, she has been a good client and repaid her loans in a timely manner. Gulnora is requesting this loan to buy a stock of women’s summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's summer clothing

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. is a 62-year-old from Silongon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, married with three children. Due to financial insufficiency she decided to engage in food retailing to have assistance in finances, specifically in their daily basic needs and school allowances. Mrs. M. is now on her 10th loan, requesting PHP 6,000. Her loan is intended for additional capital for food retailing. Her regular customers are their friends, neighbors, and relatives.

Lilia M. dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs and having money for their old age.

loans.use: additional capital for food retailing

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Дилором женщина 29-лет.Замужем имеет одного ребёнка.Она занимается продажей продуктов и питание.Она торгует в магазине где находиться в центре города Табошар.Она закупает товар из рынка "Панчшанбе" городе Худжанда.Её муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы там зарабатывать деньги, как и многие рабочие мигранты. Дилором старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать макароны, сахар и другие, для расширения своего ассортимента. Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход.
texts.en:
Dilorom is 29 years old, married, and has one child. She sells food in a shop at the center of Taboshar city. She buys her goods from the the Panshabe market in Khudjand city. Her husband is in Russia earning money to send remittances back home, like many migrant workers. Dilorom is trying to expand her business to purchase pasta, sugar, and other things to expand her product range. This is how she seeks to increase her family income.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of food products

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 59 years old. Evelyn is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Nishongul

texts.ru: Нишонгул женщина 46 лет. Замужем и имеет 2-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем. Нишонгул откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, муж Нишонгул продает их на скотном рынке. Нишонгул кредитуется в нашей организации впервые. Она хочет взять займ для приобретения 2-х бычков. Нишонгул планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Нишонгул очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Nishongul is 46, married, and has two children. She, along with her husband, buys and raises cattle, which she feeds and sells. Her husband sells their cattle on the animal market. Nihongul is requesting her first loan from our organization. She wants a loan to purchase two bulls. She plans to increase the number of her livestock, so as to increase her family's profits. Nishongul likes the conditions of the loan and she is glad that such organizations like ours exist.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and sale of cattle

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор – 33 лет. Она замужем и мать 3-х детей. Её муж уехал в Россию работать. Здесь он не смог найти хорошую работу, чтобы накопить денег и купить для себя скот. У Гулбахор было всего лишь 15 овец. Но недавно она узнала о кредитовании нашей организации, и пришла брать кредит для покупки одной дойной коровы. Пока ее муж найдет работу в России и пришлет ей деньги, ей будет помогать ее брат. Гулбахор очень рада что в трудный момент ее жизни наша организация помогает ей.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her husband went to Russia to find work, as at home, he was unable to find a good job so that they could save money and buy cattle.Gulbahor only had 15 sheep. But recently, she learned about our organization and took out a loan to purchase a dairy cow. While her husband will find work in Russia and send her remittances, her brother will help her out. Gulbahor is very pleased that our organization is helping her during a difficult moment in her life.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling cattle

loans.name: Eunise

texts.en:
Eunise D. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 33 years old. Eunise is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eunise owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Eunise has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Eunise joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eunise has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Eunise is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Eunise from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory  and as working capital

loans.name: Shyryl

texts.en:
Shyryl D. is a rice grower. She started her business a long time ago using a 2-hectare farm that she inherited from her parents. Her husband Ronaldo D. is the one managing their farm. As parents, they do all they can to provide their children a bright future by working harder in the fields.

As she aspires for an abundant harvest, Shyryl thinks of buying fertilizer, pesticides, herbicide and other farm needs. She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. The loan will help her achieve the maximum yield from her farm. "In that way our household cash flow would be easily to manage," she said.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and other farm needs

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima D. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Fatima is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Fatima owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Fatima has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Fatima joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fatima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4500 PHP from GDMPC. Fatima is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Fatima from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Manzurabuvi

texts.ru: Манзурабуви – молодая женщина 37 лет, замужем и мать 3-х детей. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как в сельских местностях принято рожать больше 3-х детей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Manzurabuvi is a young, 37-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is involved in livestock sales at the livestock market. And she feeds cattle at home. Manzurabuvi helps her husband with developing his business because they want to have larger profits in order to expand their family. It is customary to have more than 3 children in rural areas. They want to use this loan to increase their livestock quantity and make more profit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe L. is 48 years old, married with 4 children. They live at Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  In order to uplift their income, she sells pancakes, suman, etc. that she bakes with the help of her husband. She is now requesting a loan amounting to Php 14,900 as additional capital for her snack vending. Such a business enables them to send their children to school. She dreams of having a better life, a good income and that their children will finish their studies.

loans.use: additional capital for snack vending

loans.name: Fahriniso

texts.ru: Фахринисо - 47 года. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Занимается продажей женской одежды на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова. Она привозит товар из города Алма-аты Республики Казахстан. Иногда ездит в город Бишкек. И два раза в месяц ездит в город Истаравшан. Фахринисо уже один год кредитуется в нашей организации. За этот период она показала себя как опытный бизнесмен и своевременно погашает свой займ. Фахринисо просит займ для закупки летней партии женской одежды.
texts.en:
Fahriniso is 47 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells women’s clothing at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. She brings her merchandise from the city of Alma-Ata in the Kazakhstan Republic. Sometimes, she travels to the city of Bishkek. And twice per month, she travels to the city of Istaravshan. Fahriniso has been our client for one year. During this time, she has shown to be an experienced entrepreneur, who timely repaid her loans. Fahriniso is requesting this loan to buy a stock of women’s summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's summer clothing

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Ms. Emma M. is single and resides at Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occiddental . She is hard working and has been engaged in dried fish vending. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since March 2006; she is grateful for the benefits of savings and insurance. Now she's applying for a loan amounting to Php 10,000 as additional working capital for her dried fish vending business. Her aspiration is to save money for the future and acquire a stall in the market place in order to expand her business.

loans.use: additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Майрам 25 лет,она не замужем. Майрам торгует на рынке города Табошара продуктами  питания и товарами первой необходимости(мыло, туалетная бумага,зубная паста). Её магазин находиться в доступном месте для населения. Майрам живёт с родителями и обеспечивает своим бизнесом братьев и сестёр.На рынке и в своём городке заслужила репутацию хорошего, трудолюбивого и ответственного человека. Она получает кредит для расширения бизнеса и увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Mairam is 25 years old and single. Mairam sells food products and personal products (soap, toilet paper, toothpaste) at a market in the city of Taboshar. Her store is located in a place that people can easily access. Mairam lives with her parents and supports her brothers and sisters with her business. At the market in her town, she earned a reputation of a good, hardworking and responsible person. She requested this loan for expanding her business and increasing product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Elvilda

texts.en: Elvilda S. is 31 years old, married with 2 children, and resides at Mialen,Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her loan is intended to buy vitamins and feed for her piglets. She says that with the help of PMPC-Microfinance, her business has grown so that she has a better income now than before. The family hopes to have a comfortable life someday and be able to send their children to school and have their own decent life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for their piglets

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Like any other businessperson in their location, Merlyn Peranco's only wish is to make her business flourish so that she can pay all the expenses in their household. She is 29 years old and the mother of three children. Her business is rice farming. She tills a hectare of farmland to produce abundant harvests. Aside from that, she also has pigs. She takes good care of her hogs to be able to earn a bigger profit. She is also starting to raise ducks.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. The loan will greatly help them increase their income. Through CEVI, she has been able to sustain her livelihood for a very long time. CEVI gives her not just credit assistance but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 47 years old. Elena is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Elena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Good Hope Masika Joan Group

texts.en:
M. Joan is 32 years old and married with four children who are going to school. She also looks after three dependents.

M. Joan has been running her business of selling beans so far for two years. She is using the loan to purchase bags of beans, adding to her stock for sale. She is an active business lady whose dream is to build a residential house.

loans.name: Leonore

texts.en:
Leonore A. owns a small rice field. She is 29 years old and has three children. Her husband, Rufel A., is the one managing their business. The harvest from their farm goes a long ways to help pay tuition and other school expenses of their children. Some of their income is used to provide for their basic needs.

Their dream is to acquire another hectare of farm land. This is what her heart is pushing her to do. Now, she needs a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the needed fertilizers and pesticides.

In all of Leonore's business endeavors, CEVI has been giving support to make the business grow. She receives training and insurance coverage as well loans.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, ammonium, pesticides and other farming supplies

loans.name: Cherlylyn

texts.en: Cherlylyn M. is applying for a loan of 12,000 PHP as additional working capital for a sari-sari store to buy more stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items. She is 34 years old, married with two children and lives in Duanguican, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She became a member of Paglaum last January 2008. She is managing her business successfully. In fact, it covers their daily needs and she is able to save money for the education of their children.

loans.use: To restock a sari-sari store

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Rodney B. owns and operates a motorcycle transport business providing service to local community members. He is 25 years old and married. He is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Rodney has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rodney joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Rodney is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Babughirana B Kabugho Veronica Group

texts.en: K. Veronica is a married business lady ,age 30 years old, blessed with four children going to school and looking after her mother. She has been operating a business manufacturing local brew for seven years so far. She is using this loan to purchase millet flour and yeast to manufacture the local brew. K. Veronica is a hardworking business lady who is managing to take care of her family. Her hope for the future is to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase millet flour and yeast for manufacturing local brew.

loans.name: Nnechi

texts.en: Nnechi N. is 46 years old, married, and has 2 children. She retails in medicine to her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN150,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Promise Masika Topista Group

texts.en: M. Topista is a married business lady, aged 30-years, blessed with three children. The children all go to school. She has had a business of buying and selling palm oil for one year. She is using the loan to add capital and increase on her inventory of palm oil. She purchases the palm oil from Congo, to sell in Uganda. M. Topista is an active lady whose dream is to construct a residential house.

loans.use: To add capital and increase inventory of palm oil from Congo.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia D. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 44 years old. Cresencia is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Cresencia owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Cresencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Cresencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to be used to purchase additional inventory & to add to working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Cresencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:

Part of marriage is being responsible and to build financial stability, therefore she decided to engage in food retailing to assist in the finances of their daily basic needs and to be able to save for the future.

Mrs. C. decided to be a member of Paglaum MPC and requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to add to her capital in food retailing. Her regular customers are their friends, neighbors, and relatives. She dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs and for the future.

loans.name: Mary

She has less capital than she needs and so could not meet her customers’ demands. She is using the loan to purchase various drugs to meet her customers’ demands.

K. Betty is a hardworking woman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase various drugs to meet her customers' demands

About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.name: Carine

texts.en: Carine M. is a rice farmer. She is 25 years old and has three children. She married so early that she was not able to have a good education. Poverty is the main reason why she has not been to college. She decided to get married to Ranel M. who is a farmer. The couple are tenants which means that they are not the true owners of the farm that they are tilling. They get a share of the harvest from the farm. This has sustained their family for a long time already. Carine would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farming needs. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke is 40 years old and she is married with five children. She sells baby things like diapers, cream, clothes, etc. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Antonio Sopeai

texts.en:
Antonio Sopeai M. is originally from the city of Zavala, but currently resides in Boane, a suburb of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. Antonio originally moved from Zavala to Maputo in search of work when he was 30. Due to the civil war, his wife and children were only able to join him many years later.

Antonio is now 55 and his children are 15 and 12. Both are currently in school. On top of supporting his immediate family Antonio also sends remittance payments to his mother in Zavala.

Antonio is employed as a bartender at Restaurante Imperial in Boane. He is requesting this loan to help finance the construction of his home. This will be his third loan from Hluvuku. The other three he has successfully paid back.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer O. sells processed food like hot dogs, chorizo (a spicy pork sausage), ham, and meat. She is 47 years old and has four children. She started her business in 2007 using her own savings. From that, she was able to start selling meats and other processed foods in their village.

Now, she is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more processed food and meat to sell. The loan will really help her to increase her income. When that happens, she will be able to extend more support to her children.

Through CEVI, she has been able to sustain her business for a long time. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy processed food and meat to sell

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.en:
Djumagul lives with her husband and her three children. She is a tailor who offers her great services to her neighbors. Her earnings are used to help cover her household expenses. Her work and her financial contribution have enhanced her self-esteem and her self-confidence. Djumagul is very proud of her work. This is the third time that Djumagul has requested a loan from IMON International, a Kiva partner. Having said this, Djumagul has an excellent history of on-time repayment. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Renalwa

texts.en:
Renalwa M. is from Baclayon, Bohol. Her business is a sari-sari (variety) store. Her age is 59. And the year she started a business is 2004. She has been selling various types of goods to earn a living for her family. Like any other businessperson, she has been aiming for success in her business to save for her grandchildren. 

The loan she seeks from CEVI, a Kiva partner, is for Php 4,000. She will buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store. She thinks that by doing so, she will be able to attract more customers.

She has been blessed that she joined the CEVI program. She receives not only loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: D. Jeanne est née le 27/12/1949 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Jeanne est mère de cinq (5) enfants tous scolarisés. Jeanne habite le quartier GBEDAGBA de Cotonou. Jeanne vend de fruits qu'elle livre en gros aux détaillants de fruits qui s'installent aux bords de la voie. C'est dans les villages que Jeanne achète ses fruits qu'elle revient livrer à Cotonou. Jeanne a déjà eu deux crédits de ALIDé pour développer son activité de vente de fruits. Jeanne a bien remboursé tous les deux crédits. Jeanne sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour accroître les stocks de ses marchandises afin de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Jeanne was born on December 27, 1949 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Bénin. Jeanne is the mother of 5 children, all enrolled in school. She lives in the Gbedagba neighborhood of Cotonou.

Jeanne sells fruit which she delivers wholesale to retailers of fruit who set themselves up along the roadside. She buys the fruit that she brings to Cotonou in the villages. She has already had two loans from ALIDé to develop her business selling fruit. She reimbursed the two loans correctly and is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé to increase her stocks so that she can better serve her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of baskets of fruit to re-sell wholesale

loans.name: Gulguncha

texts.ru: Гулгунча Махмадова проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 35 лет. Замужем, детей не имеет. Гулгунча более 4 лет занимается пашивом одежды, этой услугой она занимается у себя дома. Муж предоставляет услугу такси. Клиентка просит кредит для расширения деятельности.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:

Augusta graduated from high school and began her studies in economics at the university level, but was forced to leave after her second year in order to take care of her children. Since 1997 she has had a business selling used clothes, charcoal and beverages and currently employs two assistants. Her most popular products are soft drinks and beer, which she buys wholesale and sells at retail prices. 

Augusta has previously taken out loans with the organization GTZ; this will be her first loan with Hluvuku, a Kiva partner. She intends to use this loan to increase her business' inventory to meet the demands of her clientele. In the near future, she would like to open a second point of sale for her business in order to increase profits. She currently is working out of a stall, but dreams of opening a store of her own.

loans.name: Bibiradjab

texts.en: Bibiradjab is the married mother of three children. She has twenty years experience in her tailor shop. On her own initiative she began to elaborate garments, which she then began to sell. This endeavor went very well and, little by little, she has been purchasing different kinds of sewing machines for her store. She works every day of the week from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Bibiradjab is requesting this loan in order to purchase a new electrical sewing machine, which is currently on sale, and which she needs very much. With this investment, she will be able to improve her earnings and to improve her store. Also, she will be able to give a better product to her customers. Bibiradjab would like to be able, little by little, to improve her quality of life and to remodel her tailor shop so that it looks nicer. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing a new sewing machine which is on sale

loans.name: Shahrabonu

texts.ru: Шахрабону Назарова  берет очередной кредит. Ей  необходимо купить корову.В настоящий момент выгодно покупать  , потому что все коровы  дают молоко. А это хороший бизнес : она делает из молока : ряженку ,сливки и крут (кисломолочные круглые шарики). Благодаря кредиту она также открыла новый вид бизнеса в "Атуш"-базаре, продавая одежду. За скотом могут ухаживать и дети с  мужем. Таким образом за счет займа ее семья смогут увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли. Шахрабону всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ и поэтому она смогла помочь мужу для увеличения количества своего скота. Она благодарит нас и КИВУ за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Shahrabonu N. is taking out another loan. She needs to buy a cow. At this time it is profitable to buy because all cows give milk. And it is a good business: she makes milk products such as buttermilk, heavy cream and krut which is sour milk balls. Thanks to the loans she has opened a new type of business in the Atush market selling clothing. The children and husband can take care of the cattle. This way because of the loan the family can increase the headcount of cattle and make more profit. Shahrabonu always uses her loans purposefully and this is why she could helped her husband to increase the amount of cattle. She is thanking us and Kiva for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn P. is 23 years old and the single parent of one child. She once experienced failure on her farm. She failed to buy insecticides and, as a result, she had a stunted harvest. She lost so much money from the very poor harvest that she doesn't want it to happen again! She has been doing everything possible to make her farm productive.  

Marlyn is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy needed fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides for her farm. She thinks that this action will lead her to an abundant harvest on her farm. 

Marlyn is an active client of Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She is happy joining in the cluster meetings every week. Aside from the loan that CEVI offers, she is enjoying the insurance coverage and training as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, insecticides, fertilizers and other farming needs

loans.name: Barfiyamo

texts.ru: Барфиямо Шодмонова проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 42 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Барфиямо имеет арендованную, торговую точку на рынке, где торгует морожным, напитками и т.д. Муж находится в России на заработках. Клиент просит кредит, для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Barfiyamo S. lives in the Yavan district. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. Barfiyamo leases a retail stand at the market, where she sells ice-cream, drinks, etc. Her husband is working in Russia. Our client is requesting this loan for business expansion.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mamur

texts.en: S. Mamur is a hard working, 49-year-old man who has considerably improved his economic situation by growing potatoes and carrots. Mamur grows a native variety of potato and carrot and sells them at the market. He is saving money in order to become a taxi driver in the future, when his efforts in the field no longer are fruitful. He feels happy to have the privilege of being a father to four children. In order to have a successful harvest, Mamur is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy sacks of seeds and organic fertilizer for his crop. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joseph Tsetse

texts.en:
Joseph Tsetse A. sells cosmetics and trinkets at Kormantse near Cape Coast. Joseph Tsetse has received tertiary education. He is married and has four dependents and his wife is also a trader.

Joseph Tsetse has been selling cosmetics and jewelry since 1987. He is responsible for taking care of the family's financial needs and the children's education as well. His loan will be used to buy more cosmetics and trinkets to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to expand the business and to create employment for the needy.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and trinkets to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila P. is a farmer and is 48 years old this year. She grows rice which she uses to feed her children and to buy the basic needs for their family. She owns the farm that she and her husband till. Farming is the only thing that sustains their family.

Now, Leonila is thinking of buying a quart of herbicides and insecticides as well as sacks of fertilizer. These will help facilitate a good harvest and income for her family. This is the very reason why she applied for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI).

CEVI helps her achieve her long-term goal. She hopes that she will be able to grow her livelihood more in the future through CEVI’s help.

loans.use: To purchase a quart of herbicides and insecticdes as well as sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Mahmadnazar

texts.en:
Mahmadnazar is a very hardworking and responsible entrepreneur. He is married and has two children and he and his family live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan.

Mahmadnazar works in the central city market selling men’s clothing and shoes. He has been working in the market for two years and his business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. Once a month he travels to the neighboring city of Istaravshan to purchase new goods. Mahmadnazar likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family.

Today, Mahmadnazar would like to ask for a loan of 2,000 Somoni in order to purchase new clothing to sell. We believe his drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Mahmadnazar’s business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Agnes Tawiah

texts.en:
Agnes Tawiah Q. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high school.

Agnes Tawiah sells watches, plates and jewelry at Mankesim near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1987. She uses her income for housekeeping. She will use the loan to purchase more plates and trinkets to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to expand her business and also to save towards building a house.

loans.use: To purchase more plates and trinkets to sell

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.en:
Cacilda C. is 37 years old, is divorced from her husband, and currently lives in Namaacha. She has four children between the ages of 10 and 18 who are currently in school. She studied until the 7th grade and was forced to stop due to pregnancy. When she got pregnant she moved in with her husband. The couple had three more children before she was left by her husband and forced to find work.

Cacilda started selling used clothes and saved up enough money to buy a piece of land on which to build a home. She buys used clothes in South Africa and then returns to Mozambique to sell the clothes in Boane and Maputo. With this loan she plans on increasing her business inventory.

This will be Cacilda's third loan with Hluvuku. She hopes to see her business continue to grow, allowing her to make improvements to her home and ensure that her children can continue to study.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
Roldan A. is a 37-year-old farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, which is a poor community in Mindanao where the livelihood of most people is farming and raising animals like chickens and ducks. Roldan also grows corn. He wants to make his farm productive to be able to send his three children to school and provide them a better quality of life.

On learning about the services offered by Community Economic Ventures Inc. in their area, he immediately applied for a loan worth Php 10,000. He plans to buy fertilizer and other farming needs. He hopes that his investment will have good returns so that he will be able to support his family well.

As a CEVI client, he receives insurance coverage and training aside from the loan that CEVI gives.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farming needs

loans.name: Makhsud

texts.en:
A. Makhsud, aged 36, is married with 4 children. He earns his living through farming, specifically planting potatoes, carrots, and onions. Makhsud seeks room for expanding the business and creating an opportunity for his market, especially during the times he is waiting to harvest. He needs an alternative that can help him save for his children's higher education. Makhsud requests a loan of 2000 Somoni that he will spend for purchasing seeds and fertilizer for his crop.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expanding her inventory

loans.name: Chaman

texts.ru: Асанова Чаман проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Чаман более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Она хочет получить кредит и купить две дойной коровы и потом продавать молоко, а также. Ее муж находится в России на заработках, он также помогает ей, высылает ей деньги.
texts.en:
Chaman A. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 children. Chaman has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. She wants to obtain a loan and buy two dairy cows, and then sell milk. Her husband is working in Russia and also helps her by sending money.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two dairy cows

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
B. Zafar is a 42-year-old farmer who lives with his family, consisting of two children and his wife (pictured). He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. Zafar has 6 years of experience in raising cattle and selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Zafar’s orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for traders and he decided to apply for 800 USD to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Zafar is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
