She has been in this business for over 10 years, and is grateful that both parts of her businesses are doing well and help support each other. As a result, she has been able to buy cows, goats and plots of land, and pay her children’s school fees -- all from the proceeds of her hard work. She is applying for a new loan to expand her business by buying more maize and chickens to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and maize to sell to her customers

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is the married mother of five children: two sons and three daughters who are all currently in the senior high, the junior high and the primary schools. She is forty-five years old. Janet lives with her husband and children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Janet is a baker. She bakes bread in her community and supplies to retailers and beverage sellers. She also hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell as well. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She hawks in her community in the mornings. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Ama buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for one year now.

Ama is 43 years old, married and has four children: two sons and two daughters. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Ama wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es:
La señora Nancy Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Cochapamba en la comunidad de San Miguel Alto, ubicada aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Tiene 43 años, y está casada con 4 hijos. Su hija mayor ya está casada con familia propia, y sus otros hijos todavía viven con ella; tienen 21, 12 y 4 años. Su esposo está en Brooklyn, Estados Unidos, trabajando de albañil. Se fue hace 5 años, cuando ella recién se había quedado embarazada con su hijita menor. Esa etapa fue muy difícil para Nancy, pero es una señora muy fuerte y resistió. 

Sra. Nancy tiene un negocio de crianza de cuyes. Lleva un año criando cuyes, y ahora tiene unos 70. Los vende para asados y ocasiones especiales como primeras comuniones, grados, y otras fiestas comunales. Suele venderlos por época; por ejemplo, ahora está vendiendo bastantes para fiestas de grado. También tiene algunas ovejas. Sra. Nancy antes tenía una tienda en la ciudad de Cuenca, pero después de que nació su hijita decidió quedarse en la casa para estar más cerca de su familia. 
La señora está pidiendo un préstamo de $550 para la compra de alimentos para sus cuyes; específicamente comprará llano. Su meta para el futuro es poner un negocio fuera de su casa ya cuando vuelve su esposo del extranjero. Él espera volver dentro de dos o tres años.
texts.en:
Nancy Elena is a member of the “Cochapamba” communal bank in the community of San Miguel Alto, which is located approximately a half-hour outside of the city of Cuenca, in the south of Ecuador. She is 43 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Her oldest daughter is already married and has her own family. Nancy’s other children still live with her. They are 21, 12, and 4 years old. Her husband is in the United States, in Brooklyn, working as a mason. He left 5 years ago, when she had just gotten pregnant with her youngest daughter. This was a very difficult time for Nancy, but she is a very strong woman and she pulled through. Nancy has a business raising guinea pigs. She has been raising guinea pigs for a year, and now she has about 70 of them. She sells them for barbeques and special occasions such as first communions, graduations, and other communal parties. She also has some sheep. Nancy used to have a store in Cuenca, but after she had her daughter, she decided to stay at home to be closer to her family. Nancy is requesting a loan of $550 to buy feed for her guinea pigs; specifically, she will buy forage. Her goal for the future is start a business outside of her home when her husband returns from the United States. He hopes to come back within two or three years.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buy feed for guinea pigs

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A. is twenty-nine years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, both daughters. Both are currently in the primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Gifty is a trader and trades in cereals – rice. She buys her goods from Kumasi and nearby communities and supplies to other retailers and food vendors. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk. She has been in business for two years and aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Blanca Aidee

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Aidee es la presidenta del Banco Comunal Cochapamba en la comunidad de San Miguel Alto, ubicada aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Tiene 33 años, está casada, y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 8 años. 
La señora se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de fruta; tiene un puesto en la Feria Libre de Cuenca. Ella trabaja vendiendo fruta desde los ocho años. Su mamá también vendía fruta, pero lamentablemente falleció hace un par de años. Blanca trabaja de las 8am hasta las 2pm o 3pm de martes a sábado (los días domingo y lunes pasa en casa con su familia). Hay bastante competencia en el mercado, pero dice que consigue clientes regulares porque les trata bien para que vuelvan, y además siempre les da su “yapa” (un poquito extra que se da de regalo).  
Blanca necesita un préstamo de $1,100 para poder comprar chirimoyas, uvas y manzanas para abastecer a su puesto en el mercado. También piensa comprar animales menores y cobijas para otros pequeños negocios que a veces hace. 
La señora es socia de Fundación Espoir hace 10 años ya. Blanca dice que le gusta sacar la plata y ahorrar. Su meta para el futuro es seguir trabajando para dar un buen ejemplo a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca Aidee is the president of the Cochapamba comunal bank in the community of San Miguel Alto, located approximately one half-hour from the city of Cuenca, in the south of Ecuador. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two children who are 15 and 8 years old. Blanca sells all kinds of fruit. She has a stall in the Open Market of Cuenca. She has been selling fruit for eight years. Her mother also sold fruit but, unfortunately, she passed away a couple of years ago. Blanca works from 8am until 2 or 3pm Tuesday through Saturday. (She spends Sundays and Mondays with her family.) There is a lot of competition in the market, but she says she has regular customers because she treats them well so that they will come back. She also always gives them a “yapa” (a little bit extra that she gives as a gift). Blanca needs a loan of $1,100 so she can buy chirimoyas [also known as custard apples], grapes, and apples to stock her stall in the market. She is also planning to buy small animals and blankets for other small business deals that she occasionally does. Blanca has been a member of Fundación Espoir for 10 years. She says that she likes earning money and saving. Her goal for the future is to continue working so she can be a good example to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and stock her market stall

loans.name: Gladys Judith

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Judith es la secretaria del Banco Comunal Cochapamba en la comunidad de San Miguel Alto, ubicada aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Como secretaria, le toca anotar y leer todos los minutos de las reuniones del grupo y guardar los cuadernos del banco comunal. Gladys tiene 23 años y está casada, tiene un hijo de cinco años. Trabaja como empleada en una casa; ya lleva dos años trabajando así. Trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8am a 3:30pm. También tiene un negocio vendiendo ropa a sus amigos y familiares; compra la ropa en la Feria Libre de Cuenca y sus clientes le paguen en cuotas. 
Gladys está pidiendo este crédito para poder comprar más ropa de mujer, hombre y niño para poder satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes. 
Gladys es socia de la Fundación Espoir hace más que dos años, y dice que le gusta bastante. Ha usado gran parte de sus créditos para su negocio de ropa; también ha usado los créditos para la compra de materiales para terminar la construcción de su casa, donde vive actualmente con su esposo y su hijo. 
Su sueño para el futuro es poner su propia tienda de ropa en la comunidad donde vive.
texts.en:
Gladys Judith is the secretary of the Cochabamba communal bank in the community of San Miguel Alto, located approximately one half-hour from the city of Cuenca, in the south of Ecuador. As secretary, it is her responsibility to take and read the minutes of the group’s meetings and to keep them in the communal bank’s notebooks. Gladys is 23 years old, is married, and has one five year-old child. She works as a domestic servant; she has been working in this for two years. She works Monday through Friday, 8am to 3:30pm. She also has a business selling clothing to her friends and family members. She buys the clothing in the Open Market of Cuenca and her customers pay her in installments. Gladys is requesting a loan to buy more clothing for women, men, and children in order to satisfy the requests of her customers. Gladys has been a member of Fundación Espoir for more than two years, and she says she likes it a lot. She has used most of her loans to purchase clothing; she has also used some of her loans to buy materials to finish building her house, where she lives with her husband and her child. Her dream for the future is to open her own clothing store in the town where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men, and children to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa B. is thirty-eight years old. She is not married and has no child. She lives with two of her nieces in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Yaa is a fishmonger and sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a table at the market square and also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them herself. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Damaris Margarita

texts.es: La señora Damaris Margarita tiene la edad de 41 años, reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 16 y 22 años de edad, que estudian, su negocio es  una pequeña pulpería que administra desde hace varios años y por las noches hace fritanga para obtener mejores ingreso, inicio con ahorros, luego opto por prestamos para hacer crecer su negocio y poder ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de producto como diferentes platillos. Con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de  granos básicos, bebidas como: gaseosas, jugos. Golosinas, productos enlatados entre otros. Sus planes es poder ayudar a sus hijos que concluyan sus estudios. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo de los préstamos ya que se ha beneficiado para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Damaris Margarita is 41 years old, lives in the 380 neighborhood in the capital of Managua and has two children of 16 and 22 years of age who are in school. Her business is a small local store that she has run for several years and at night she makes fried food in order to obtain more income. She began with savings and later opted for loans in order to make her business grow and to be able to offer her clients a variety of products such as different dishes. With this loan, she wants to invest in the purchase of basic grains, drinks such as soda and juice, candy, and canned products among other things. Her plan is to be able to help her children finish their studies. She gives thanks to the institution for support with the loans because she has benefited from them by investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, soda, juice and candy

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina I. is 36 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters. All are currently in school – junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a trader. Amina is also a trader. She trades in foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, etc. Amina wants a loan to buy foodstuffs in bulk. She supplies to other retailers and food vendors. She buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for four years. Amina aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. is 35 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Mary is a fishmonger. She sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. Mary buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them herself. She has been in business for over 15 years and wants a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk. Mary desires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, tiene 44 años y vive en su propia casa junto a su familia a la cual cuida con mucho cariño y lo que más desea es darles una buena vida. Demetria sale muy temprano a vender sus productos andinos en el mercado Manco Capac (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), tiene un puesto donde vende papa, quinua, oca, etc, pasa todo el día en espera de que sus clientes le compren los productos que vende, Demetria es muy alegre por lo cual su puesto es muy concurrido. Lleva 22 años realizando este negocio y lo que más le gusta es que puede conversar con sus clientes y hacer más amena la venta, pero lo más difícil de su trabajo tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto cuidándolo. Aun así sabe que todos los esfuerzos los realiza con el único fin de sobresalir en la vida. Para un futuro cercano, Demetria desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus productos andinos y atender mejor a sus clientes. Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a separar una parte de las ganancias del día, para pagar el crédito sin problemas. En su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que le da alegría a sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Demetria is a very happy and hard-working woman. She is 44 and lives in her own home with her family, whom she cares for with a lot of love. What she wants the most is to give them a good life. Demetria leaves her home very early to sell her Andean products in the Manco Capac market (a very important market in the city of Juliaca). She has a stand there where she sells potatoes, quinoa, geese, and other items. She spends the whole day there hoping that customers will buy the products that she sells. Demetria is very happy because her stand is very frequented. She has had this business for 22 years, and what she likes the most about it is being able to converse with her customers because it makes her sales more pleasant. The most difficult part of her job is having to stay at her stand all day to care for it. She knows that she makes all of her efforts with the only goal of excelling at life. In the near future, Demetria hopes to have a stand where she can sell her Andean products in more comfort and attend to her clients better. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is willing to set aside part of her profits every day to pay back the credit with no problems. In her communal bank, she is very loved since she brings happiness to the other members. With the 1,500 PEN she is requesting, she will buy more products to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Nassiratou

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce ce qui a fait qu’elle a une parfaite maîtrise de ce commerce. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle grandissante, elle veut associer à son commerce de pagnes le commerce de bijoux, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 différents bijoux et 15 colliers. Elle est mariée et mère de 01 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman sells "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) to earn her living. She has been in this business for 3 years, which means that she has a perfect mastery of the trade. She buys her inventory in the big open-air market of Lomé.

As her clientele is growing, she wants to add to this business selling "pagnes" the sale of costume jewelry, so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 20 different pieces of jewelry and 15 necklaces. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pagnes and costume jewelry

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Doña Teresa de Jesús reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, casada, su esposo es cadete de taxi, sus hijos son mayores de edad,  sus metas es poder terminar de construir su casa, su negocio es la venta de tortilla que desde hace treinta años inicio con fondos propios para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, desde horas muy temprana se levanta a lavar al maíz ya que por la noche lo deja nesquizado  para luego ir a moler al molino y poder comenzar a palmear las tortillas que se venden a primera hora de la mañana. Este es su décimo ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para reparar el techo y hacer un pequeño arranque de muro. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios que ha tenido en la mejora de su casa.
texts.en:
Doña Teresa de Jesús lives in the "380" neighborhood of the capital of Managua. She is married and her husband is a taxi driver. Her children are all grown up. Her goal is to be able to finish building her house. Her business is selling tortillas which she began doing 13 years ago with her own funds in order to assist her husband with the expenses. She gets up in the early morning hours to wash the corn which she cooked with ash the night before and left soaking. Next she goes to grind it at the mill so she can shape with her hands the tortillas which she then sells at the stroke of dawn. This is her tenth loan from AFODENIC and it will be used to buy construction materials to repair the roof and build a small section of wall. She is grateful to the institution for the financial assistance she has had in improving house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana tiene 46 años, es una vecina muy querida y respetada en su barrio, vive sola en su propia casa y anhela tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella pasa sus días arreglando bicicletas viejas, las cuales luego de repararlas las vende en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en Juliaca). El trabajo que realiza es muy bueno y las bicicletas quedan casi como nuevas, motivo por el cual su puesto es siempre muy concurrido. A Juliana le gusta mucho arreglar bicicletas, ya que se divierte bastante con ello, lleva 15 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que realizar todo a mano, lo cual hace que se demore mucho y que su trabajo sea más agotador. Para un futuro cercano, Juliana desea hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, para ello está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está bromeando con sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más repuestos de bicicletas para realizar mejores reparaciones.
texts.en:
Juliana is 46 and is a very well-loved and respected neighbor in her area. She lives alone in her own home and she hopes to have a better quality of life. She spends her days fixing old bicycles, which she later sells at the Explanada Laguna Temporal (a place where there are markets in Juliaca). The work she does is very good, and the bicycles end up almost like new. This is why her stand in the market is very frequented. Juliana likes fixing bicycles a lot since she has quite a bit of fun with it. She has done this work for 15 years, and she thinks the most difficult part is having to do everything by hand. It takes longer and makes her work exhausting. In the near future, Juliana hopes to grow her business and improve her economic income, for which she is willing to work very hard. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she knows that she has to make all of her payments on time. She is very happy with her communal bank, and she is is always joking with her fellow members. With the 500 PEN she is requesting, she plans to buy more bicycle parts to make better repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bicycle parts

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina B. is 52 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. She is a food vendor. Georgina prepares and sells kenkey. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Georgina has been in business for four years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Akofa

texts.fr:
Cette femme a entamé en 2002, le commerce de charbons et du bois de chauffage. En cette saison de pluie une partie de son stock a été détruite par la pluie, pour se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons  et 15 bois de chauffage. 
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, avec son revenu elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman began selling charcoal and firewood in 2002. In this rainy season, part of her inventory has been spoiled by the rain. In order to replenish it, she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 20 sacks of charcoal and 15 of firewood.

She is married and the mother of 3 children. With her income, she contributes to supporting the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria, de 45 años, es una mujer muy sincera y honesta, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Raúl de 47 años y su querida hija Natalia de 12 años. Se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios como la papa, quinua, oca, etc, en el mercado Manco Capac (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), es muy alegre y conversadora, por lo cual sus clientes prefieren comprarle a ella, además trabaja junto a su hija, quien le ayuda en todas las ventas que realiza. Maria disfruta mucho de conversar son sus vecinas de venta, mientras vende sus productos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es que después de cada día de ventas termina muy sucia por la tierra de la papa. Para un futuro cercano, Maria desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos andinos y así de esa manera mejorar su calidad de vida para darle a su hija unos buenos estudios superiores. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos andinos para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 and is a very sincere and honest woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Raúl, who is 47, and her beloved daughter, Natalia, who is12. She sells nutritious products like potatoes, quinoa, geese, etc., in the Manco Capac market (a very important market in the city of Juliaca). She is very happy and chatty, which is why her customers prefer to buy from her. She also works with her daughter, who helps her with all of the sales that she makes. Maria enjoys chatting with the people who have stands near her while she sells her products. She has done this work for 15 years. What she likes the least is that she gets dirty after every day of selling because of the dirt on the potatoes. In the near future, Maria hopes to have a stand where she can sell her Andean products and in this way improve her quality of life to give her daughter a higher education. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is willing to make all of her payments on time because she doesn't want to cause any problems with her communal bank, where she is very loved by the other members. With the 1,000 PEN she is requesting, she will buy more Andean products to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Rincon Portada Group

texts.es:
En la conocida feria 16 de julio ubicada en la zona del mismo nombre (ciudad de El Alto) ofrecen sus productos las integrantes de la asociación “Rincón Portada” pertenece al centro focal Alto Lima, está formado por once miembros que lograron consolidarse en este grupo hace cinco años aproximadamente.
Se dedican a la venta de verduras, queso, medias, carne de pollo, ropa tejida a mano, también realizan tejidos artesanales, elaboran pipocas (palomitas de maíz) y también confeccionan colchones.
Ahora la asociación Rincón Portada necesita comprar mercadería y materia prima  para aumentar su producción y posteriores ventas, tienen la seguridad que obtendrán mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The members of the Rincón Portada association sell their products in the well known 16 de julio fair, which is located in the zone of the same name (city of El Alto). They belong to the Alto Lima community center. The group formed approximately five years ago with 11 members. They sell vegetables, cheese, socks, chicken, and hand woven clothes. They also make handicrafts, popcorn, and mattresses. The Rincón Portada association now needs to buy merchandise and raw materials to increase their production and sales. They are sure that they will obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Rc Primary School, Binkolo Group

texts.en:
These are staff members of the RC Primary School, Binkolo. RC Primary School is located in Binkolo village about six miles from Makeni City. The school was built by Plan International, a non-governmental organization in 1980 but now run by the Catholic Mission in Binkolo village. The school has a total of fourteen dedicated staff on their payroll and 514 pupils. Others from neighboring schools or feeder schools near Binkolo village have joined RC Primary School Binkolo to apply for this loan making the total number of applicants seventeen.

SMT/Kiva gives loans to teachers and other professional workers in Sierra Leone in order to invest in something meaningful. Salaries are usually too small for these people, making it very difficult to do anything big with it. But with a loan, they will be able to buy a piece of land or house-building materials. Some will pay school fees either for themselves to pursue further studies or for their children. Some will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture like a bed or chairs. And others will invest in a business or add to their wives’ businesses. Each month, their school’s bursar will deduct their repayment out of their monthly salaries and repay SMT/Kiva.

David L. K. (second row right) is the headmaster at the school. David L. K. was born in Mankoreh village about nine miles from Makeni City. He is age 62 and married with 12 children. One of his children is in university, five in senior secondary schools, four in junior secondary school and two in primary schools. David has been a headmaster of this school since 1984.  David will use his loan to complete the house he is currently building. He will buy bags of cement, sand, gallons of paints, and hard boards. Asked what impact this loan will create in his life, Mr. K. told me that he felt somehow alleviated, and economically uplifted. “At least”, he continued, “I will be able to leave a legacy for my family by building them a house”.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to complete house

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy A. is 30 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one son and one daughter. Both are currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer. Lucy is also a trader. She trades in foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, etc. She wants a loan to buy foodstuffs in bulk. Lucy supplies to other retailers and food vendors. She buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for five years. Lucy aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Taïbatou

texts.fr:
Cette dame est une résidente du quartier d’awatamé, qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce  de produits cosmétiques et de bijoux. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et fait ce commerce depuis 1997. Pour toucher un plus grand nombre de clients elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. Elle fait face en ce moment à une rupture de stock et elle voudrait se réapprovisionner. Elle demande alors à WAGES un crédit pour acheter  divers produits cosmétiques et une douzaine de bijoux.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady is a resident of the Awatamé neighborhood, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. In order to earn her living, she sells cosmetics and costume jewelry. She buys her inventory at the big open-air market of Lomé and has been in this business since 1997.

So as to contact a greater number of customers, she makes her sales on foot and door-to-door. At the present time several products in her inventory are expended, and she would like to replenish them. She is therefore asking WAGES for a loan to buy various cosmetics and a dozen pieces of costume jewelry.

She is married and is the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena Y. is 32 years old. She is married and has two children—both daughters. One is currently in junior high and the other in primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Abena sells food stuffs such as yam, plantain, and so forth. She wants a loan to buy food stuffs in bulk. Abena sells her products to other retailers and food vendors. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Abena has been in business for three years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita O. is 28 years old. She is married and has one child—a daughter who is in primary school. Rita lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Rita sells food stuffs such as cassava, yam, plantain, and so forth. She wants a loan to buy food stuffs in bulk. She sells her products to other retailers and food vendors. Rita buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for six years. She aspires to expand her business and give her child a good education.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth K. is 50 years old. She is married and has seven children—three daughters and four sons. All are currently in the senior high, junior high, and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Elizabeth is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells on a tabletop at the lorry station in the mornings and evenings. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Elizabeth buys her goods from Kumasi and nearby communities. She has been in business for over 30 years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet N. is 70 years old. She is widowed and has eight children—five sons and three daughters. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Janet sells vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, pepper, and so forth on a tabletop at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and Kumasi. Janet also treks to other towns to sell her products on their market days. She has been in business for some years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Scarlet Ivania

texts.es: Doña Scarlet es una mujer muy trabajadora con mucho deseo de superación en la vida ya que ha sido difícil poder lograr sus objetivos en tener una casa digna para su familia ya que su sueldo es bajo, trabaja de ejecutiva de ventas en una empresa privada anteriormente era la cocinera y la ascendieron hace un año por su dedicación y empeño lo cual esta muy contenta  por que esta logrando  sus planes. Tiene 27 años de edad, casada, reside en el bario Hialeah en la capital de Managua y con dos hijos, que estudian la primaria, su esposo es guarda de seguridad. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer las paredes de concreto y poder estar segura ya que el zinc de su casa esta ya en mal estado. Da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo y la facilidad de pago lo cual es de mucho beneficio en su vida personal, un sueño poder tener su casa.
texts.en:
Doña Scarlet is a hard-working woman who is determined to overcome obstacles in her life. She found it difficult to achieve her goal of providing a decent home for her family because she didn’t earn enough money.

She is a sales manager for a private company. Previously, she worked as a cook but was promoted a year ago because of her dedication and determination. Doña Scarlet is 27 years old, married, and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has two children who are in elementary school. Her husband is a security guard.

Her loan will be used to buy materials to build secure concrete walls, since the existing zinc walls of her house are already in poor condition. She thanks AFODENIC for providing her with a loan and trusting in her ability to repay. It is of great personal benefit to her that she can fulfill her dream of having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Jane Nduta

texts.en: Jane is a 29-year-old single lady. She is a dairy farmer, rears pigs, and also runs a brokerage for garbage services in Uthiru, Nairobi. She has been doing dairy farming for the past two years. This is Jane's second loan from KADET. With her first loan she bought a cow and three piglets. Jane needs to pay school fees for her younger sister, Rose, who is in her second semester. Rose is taking a course in early childhood education. Their father paid for the first semester but now Jane has offered to pay for the second semester. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To pay for her sister's tuition

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia A. is 40 years old. She is married and has four children—two sons and two daughters. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Felicia sells food items such as groundnuts, vegetables, oil, and so forth on a tabletop at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and Kumasi. Felicia also treks to other towns to sell her products on their market days. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El joven Juan Carlos García, es contador de una empresa privada desde hace dos año logro ubicarse el cual se siente muy contento ya que con mucho sacrificio pago sus estudios. Tiene 25 años de edad, reside en un bario de la capital de Managua Monseñor Lezcano, su esposa trabaja de mesera en un comedor, tiene una niña de 3 años de edad que cuida su mama para poder laborar y apoyar a su esposo. Con este crédito quiere realizar aumento en un cuarto lo cual comprara materiales de construcción para hacer la obra y poder tener un comienzo.  Ya que sus anhelo es poder tener su propia casa ya que habita donde sus padres. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad del crédito el cual lograra parte de sus objetivos
texts.en:
The young man, Juan Carlos G., is an account with a private firm for the last two years. He feels very content though he has sacrificed a lot for his studies. He is 25-years old and lives in the Monsenor Lezcano borough in the capital city of Managua. His wife works as a waitress in a restaurant and they have one 3-year baby girl, who is taken care of by her mother, so that she’s able to work and support her husband.

With this loan he wants to purchase construction material to increase the size of his dwelling, where he can work and have a fresh start. It is their dream to have a proper house for their parents to live with them. Juan is grateful to Afodenic for granting this loan which will go towards achieving his objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to increasing the size of his dwelling.

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Marié et père de 01 enfants, monsieur G. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons  de bois, étant un homme et exerçant un commerce  qui est souvent effectué par les femmes, il a une meilleure manière d’attirer et de conquérir sa clientèle. En ces temps où  il pleut beaucoup au Togo, la plus a détruit une partie de son stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons de bois. C’est  avec ce qu’il gagne de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. G. is married and the father of one child, and he sells charcoal. This is a business often run by women, and he has a better way of attracting his clientele. It is very rainy at this time in Togo, and the rain destroyed part of his stock. Thus, he would like to resupply and he is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 25 sacks of charcoal. The income he gets from this business enables him to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell charcoal

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. is 52 years old. She is married and has given birth to three sons and four daughters. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Agnes trades in food items such as groundnuts, vegetables, oil, etc., on a tabletop at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and from Kumasi. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Agnes has been in business for more than 30 years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es: Doña Maria Lourdes M. tiene la edad de 54 años, reside en el bario Hialeah en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo de oficio taxista, sus hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Trabaja de cocinera desde hace veinte años es un trabajo agitado y de mucho exigencia ya que los alimentos tienen que quedar buenos. Por falta de financiamientos y de recursos no ha podido poner su propio negocio. Sus planes es poder seguir construyendo su casa, con este crédito lograra comprar materiales de construcción y construir un muro para tener seguridad. Su meta es poder poner un pequeño comedor y vender variedad de alimentos ya que tiene la experiencia adquirida y lograr una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Lourdes M. is 54 years old and resides in the Hialeah neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a taxi driver and they have adult children who live independently. She has been a cook for the past twenty years. The work is long and hectic, and demands that her food always be good.

Due to lack of funding and resources, she has not been able to open her own business. Her plan is to continue with the construction of her house. With this loan, she will purchase materials to build a security wall. Her goal is to build a small diner and sell a variety of dishes, since she has the requisite experience. She hopes this will improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells on a tabletop at the lorry station in the mornings and evenings. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Veronica buys her goods from Kumasi and nearby communities. She has been in business for ten years.

Veronica is 44 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children: two daughters and two sons. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Veronica wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica G. trades in cosmetics such as perfume, cream, pomade, powder, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the market square in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for six years now and wants a loan to buy cosmetics in bulk.

Veronica is 29 years old. She is divorced and has one child, a son, who is currently in primary school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Veronica wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Flor De Eucalipto Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Alto Lima (El Alto-La Paz), se reúne la asociación “Flor De Eucalipto”, esta formado por doce mujeres,, ellas trabajan de manera responsable en sus actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios dentro el grupo, tales como: venta de ropa, producción de colchones y payasas (colchones de paja), venta de refrescos naturales, elaboración y venta de api con pasteles (api = mazamorra de  maíz), tejidos artesanales en lana de alpaca, también tienen tiendas de consumo. La mayoría de ellas ofrecen sus productos en puestos de la feria 16 de julio ubicado en la ciudad de El alto, 
Desean aumentar su producción y ventas para esto necesitan comprar mercadería y materia prima (compra de paja, fibra de alpaca,  ropa par invierno, harina y otros)
texts.en:
In the Alto Lima Community Center you will find the “Flor De Eucalipto” (Eucalyptus Flower) Association. This group is composed of twelve women, who work responsibly as they pursue their own activities.

The members are involved in different businesses like clothing sales, production of straw mattresses, soft drink sales, production and sales of cakes with api (corn porridge), handmade fabrics of alpaca wool, and other retail shops. Many of them sell their products at the “16 de Julio” (July 16th) market located in the city of El Alto.

They all wish to increase their production and sales. For this reason, they need to buy additional merchandise and raw materials (such as straw, alpaca fiber, winter clothing, flour, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. Y. buys her goods from Kumasi and nearby communities. She sells on a tabletop at the lorry station in the mornings and evenings. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She has been in business for five years.

Y. is 32 years old. She is married and has three children, all boys. All are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Y. wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Djodjina

texts.fr: Cette femme est une femme au foyer avec ses 03 enfants, son mari est un chauffeur de taxi, le revenu de ce dernier n’arrive pas à couvrir toutes les charges de la famille, voulant l’aider,elle a commencé le commerce de pagnes, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Son stock de pagnes a baissé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite pour se faire un crédit  de WAGES pour acheter  15 pagnes de qualité « WAX ».
texts.en:
This woman is a housewife caring for her 3 children. Her husband is a taxi driver and his income is not sufficient to cover all the family's expenses. Wishing to help him, she began selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth). She buys her goods at the big open-air market in Lomé. Her stock of "pagnes" being low, she wants to restock, so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 15 "pagnes" of the « WAX » brand.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia B. is a marred mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters, who are all currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She is 47 years old. Afia lives with her husband and children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Afia is a baker. She bakes bread in her community and supplies retailers and beverage sellers. She also hawks to sell. Afia buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for over 30 years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El joven Miguel  Ángel E. tiene la edad de 29 años, su negocio es la venta de mueble de segunda mano, este negocio lo inicio con su papa, con ahorros propios. Ahora el se ha independizado y vende sus propios muebles y variedad de producto es como una tienda de segunda mano para todos aquellas personas que no tenemos la facilidad de comprar nuevos nuestros muebles. Reside en el bario Milagros de Dios en la capital de Managua, casado. Su esposa aun no le ha tenido hijos lo cual espera poder tenerlos pronto para eso espera tener mas posibilidades para aumentar su negocio. Con este crédito va a comprar materia prima como pinturas, cener, madera para reparar los productos y venderlos a buen estado. Da las gracias Afodenic por apoyo que hará crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel E. is 29. He sells used furniture, a business he started with his father using savings. Now he works on his own and sells furniture and various products in a resale store for people who are not able to purchase new furniture. He lives in the Milagros de Dios neighborhood in Managua, the capital. He is married, but he and his wife have not had children yet. They hope to be able to have children soon, and therefore want to be able to expand their business. With this loan they are going to purchase raw materials such as paint, and wood to repair items and sell them in good shape. He thanks Afodenic for the support that will help him grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood, paint, cener and other products to repair furniture and sell them in good condition.

loans.name: Leticia Jackeline

texts.es: Doña Leticia Jackeline Q. tiene la edad de 54 años, reside en la Comarca Sabana Grande  en la ciudad capitalina. Casada, con cinco hijos tres trabajan y dos están estudiando, su negocio es la costura y venta de pollo el cual desde hace seis año inicio con dinero propio. Sus planes es poder incrementar su negocio para obtener mejores utilidades. Este es su séptimo crédito en Afodenic el cual invertirá en la compra de carne, pollo, huevos, para cubrir la demanda. Sus deseos es poder ver a sus hijos que estudien. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad que ha dado para crecer en su negocio como hacer las mejoras de su casa.
texts.en:
Leticia Jackeline Q. is 54 years old. She lives in Comarca Sabana Grande in the capital city. She is married and has five children, 3 who work and 2 who are in school. She sews and sells chickens, a business she started 6 years ago with her own money. Her plans are to grow her business to obtain better returns. This is her seventh loan with Afodenic, which will be used to purchase meat, chicken and eggs to meet demand. Her hope is for her children to go to school. She is thankful to the institution for the opprortunity it has provided her to grow her business and make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, chicken, eggs and dairy products

loans.name: Akinlade

texts.fr:
Cet homme très dynamique a ouvert une boutique de prêt-à-porter en 1999, il vend des vêtements pour hommes. il dispose d’une clientèle fidèle, beaucoup de personnes aiment ses marchandises car elles sont de qualité. Voulant aménager sa boutique avec de nouveaux modèles de vêtements, il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 40 chemises hommes de nouvelle qualité et de nouveaux modèles de chaussures.
il est marié et père d’1 enfant.
texts.en:
This is a very energetic man who opened a ready-to-wear store in 1990. He sells men's clothing and has a faithful clientele, many people likes his clothes since they are of quality. Eager to supply his store with the latest clothing styles, he's seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 40 men's shirts of new quality, as well as new shoe models. He's married and the father of one child.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 40 men's shirts and shoes

loans.name: Denkoma I Group

texts.en:
Manama (left) is the leader of this group. Manama is a farmer and a petty trader. She has been a farmer for ten years now and will use this loan to buy seeds for cabbages and groundnuts, etc. She usually buys these seeds either from Kabala town or in Freetown. Manama was born in Heremakono village. She is 29 years old, married to a road constructor and they have five children together. With this loan, she will be able to increase her farm acreage and generate sufficient funds to look after herself and the children.

Manama M., Fatmata M., Kumba M., N’Bambay M. and Jima K. named their group Denkoma I. They are small scale businesswomen from the village of Heremakono, about ten miles from Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 800,000 each to help them develop their businesses.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Sorbeh Iii Group

texts.en:
Brima B. (right) is the leader of this group. Brima has been a farmer and petty trader for more than 20 years now. He plants cassavas, potatoes, garden eggs (eggplant), etc. Brima was born in Heremakono, in the Koinadugu district, northern Sierra Leone. He is 48 years old and married with eight children. Brima will invest this loan in his farm and his business. 

Brima B., Iye S., Siray K., Sarah Mara and Sirah K. are local entrepreneurs based in Heremakono, on the outskirts of Kabala town, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting loans of Le 800,000  each in order to improve their businesses. The sales-to-profit margin will improve for these entrepreneurs. Then they will be able to better look after their children in terms of feeding, clothing and paying their school fees.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es: Don Rolando Antonio E. tiene la edad de 53 años, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, ella ayuda en la panadería en el cual llevan diez años trabajando para sobresalir adelante, el inicio estos prestamos con prestamos que Afodenic otorgo este es su noveno crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar. Levadura, manteca y otros productos para elaborar el pan que día, a día hacen para vender a los diferentes barrios de la capital. Sus planes es poder contratar dos panaderos para que eleven la producción y venta del pan, a si como comprar otra camioneta para hacer fácil el traslado.
texts.en:
Don Rolando Antonio E. is 53 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in Managua, capital city of Nicaragua. He and his wife have two children who are students. His wife helps him in the bakery where they have been working for 10 years, trying to get ahead financially. Don Rolando began accepting loans granted through Kiva partner Afodenic. This is his ninth loan, which will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, yeast, butter and other products used to make bread to be sold daily in different neighborhoods in the city. His plans are to be able to hire two bakers to increase the production and sales of bread. He also wants to buy another truck to facilitate transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast and other products for making bread.

loans.name: Walekafesa I Group

texts.en:
This is Fanta K., Kaday K., Finah M., Iye M. and Aminata T.. They call their group Walekafesa I. They are small-scale businesswomen from the village of Heremakono, about ten miles from Kabala town, in the Koinadugu district, northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting loans of Le 800,000 each to help them improve the amount and quality of goods they sell. This will enable them to make better sales, improve profit, and to achieve a better standard of living.

Fanta K. (left) is the leader of this group. Fanta is a farmer and also a petty trader. With this loan, she will buy seeds and pay laborers to help her plough the land. Fanta plants cassavas and potatoes. She was born in Heremakono village, 46 years ago. She is married to a farmer and they have five children together. This loan will enable her to expand her farm and consequently make her self reliant.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luís tiene la edad de 53 años, casado su esposa le tiene dos hijos que estudian, reside en el bario Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, tiene una pulpería que administra junto a su esposa la cual tienen diez años en las venta el cual iniciaron con prestamos financieros en Afodenic, este es su doce avo crédito y da las gracias por el apoyo para invertir mas en su negocio, y las mejoras de su vivienda. Con este crédito invertirá en la compra de granos básicos. Aceite, productos de carne, pollo y lácteos, ya que son los productos básicos y consumibles para los clientes. Sus planes es poder vender otros productos que sean de sastifaccion para el cliente en la vida cotidiana. Su objetivo es apoyar a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Luis is 53 years old. He and his wife have two children who are students. He lives in the Lauerles Sur neighborhood in Managua, the capitol. With his wife her runs a grocery store that he started ten years ago with loans from AFODENIC. This is his 12th loan and he is grateful for the support that has allowed him to invest more in his business and to improve his home. With this credit he will invest in the purchase of basic grains, oil, meat products, chicken, and milk products since these are the basic consumable products for his clients. His plans include being able to sell other products that would be satisfying to his clients in their daily life. His objective is to support his three children so they can complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, chicken, and other products

loans.name: Badayaduma Group

texts.en:
Abdulai S. (left) is the leader of this group. Abdulai is a farmer and has been a farmer for over 20 years now. He will use this loan to buy cabbage and sweet potato seeds and fertilizers, and to hire labor. Abdulai was born in Heremakono village, 43 years ago. He is married to a farmer and they have eight children together.

Abdulai S., Chernor K., Feren K., Isatu S. and Iye T. are members of the Badayaduma group. They live in the village of Heremakono, about ten miles from Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone, where they run their businesses. These entrepreneurs are requesting loans of Le 800,000 each to help boost their businesses. With this group loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make better sales, and consequently improve on their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Don  Mario Alemán trabaja como guarda de seguridad, desde hace catorce años, tiene 47 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa y le tiene una hija de 17 años. Sus planes es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda para mejorar la seguridad de su casa ya que por la noche casi nunca esta ya que su trabajo no se lo permite. Este es su sexto ciclo de préstamo en Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo para poder hacer las mejoras. Con este crédito invertirá en la compra de perlines y pagar la soldadura. Su objetivo es poder segur apoyando a su única hija para que sea una profesional y pueda lograr un nivel de vida cómodo
texts.en:
Mario Alemán has worked as a security guard for 14 years. He is 47. His wife is a housewife, and they have a 17 year old daughter. Their plan is to improve the infrastructure of their house. They want to improve the security on the house because, due to his job, he is almost never home at night. This is his sixth loan cycle with Afodenic. He is thankful for the support and being able to make improvements. He will use this loan to buy beams and to pay for soldering. His objective is to be able to continue supporting his only daughter so that she will become a professional. He would also like to achieve a comfortable level of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Lino

texts.es: El señor Lino J., reside en el bario Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian en el colegio del bario. Su esposa le apoya con los gastos, lava y plancha para obtener ingresos. Con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción para hacer el fino de las paredes y el piso y mejorar su casa ya que trabaja mucho para lograr sus objetivos. Su meta es poder dar estudio a sus hijos. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo y los beneficios de plazos, ya que así ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Lino J. lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He and his wife have three children who attend the neighborhood school. His wife helps with the expenses by washing and ironing to get some income. With this loan he will buy construction materials to improve his house by finishing the walls and the floor. He works hard to achieve his objectives. His goal is to give his children an education. He gives thanks to the institution for the support and the benefit of the installments. That is how he has been able to make improvements on his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to whitewash the walls of his house and to put down a floor

loans.name: Gladys Clara

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=71109&_tpos=12&_tpg=1
Gladys es socia del Bancomunal El Roble.
Gladys es casada tiene 47 años. 
Gladys  se dedica a las ventas, ha experimentado diferentes clases de productos para vender  y   decidió  vender  lencería y ropa de cama, ella hace sus compras al por mayor en  el emporio de gamarra. 
Desde que Gladys esta en Finca su capital de trabaja ha crecido, puede comprar mas mercadería.   
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de lencería, ropa interior de mujer. 
El sueño de Gladys es tener un negoció propio, para vender lencería y otras cosas.
texts.en:
First Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=71109&_tpos=... Gladys is a member of the El Roble Community Bank. She is 47 and married. She works in sales. She has tried selling different products, but she decided to sell lingerie and sleepwear. She shops wholesale in the Emporio de Gamarra. Since Gladys has been in Finca her working capital has grown, and she can buy mO. merchandise. Gladys needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to buy lingerie and women’s sleepwear. Gladys’ dream is to have her own stO. selling lingerie and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lingerie and women's underwear

loans.name: Mayling Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Mayling Auxiliadora M. G., Juana Isabel Pérez y Ligia de los Angeles F. G..

El grupo solidario Mayling, es originario de la ciudad de Masaya de la comarca de Quebrada Honda, de forma general se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras en el M. de Masaya y de Tipitapa.
Las tres miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son vecinas y se unen para la compra de algunos productos y así logran mejores precios. 

Doña Mailing Auxiliadora es soltera, no tiene hijos pero ella trabaja para poder tener su casa y ayudar a sus padres, se dedica  la venta de frutas y verduras, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre y desde hace dos años ella es independiente en su negocio, inicia sus labores desde tempranas horas de la madrugada y termina hasta las tres de la tarde, espera cumplir sus metas y después casarse. Ella  se propone pagar los créditos con mucha puntualidad y animar a las integrantes para salir adelante, ella es la coordinadora del grupo. 
Doña Juana Isabel Pérez, es casada , sin hijos y es muy trabajadora, ella vende también en el M., tiene muchos clientes porque es muy conocida. Su meta es de mejorar su vivienda y dejarla como ella quiere, para cuando sea mayor tenga comodidades y con el crédito ella piensa seguir invirtiendo para tener mas clientes y mayores ventas.
Doña Ligia de los Angeles F. es una joven madre de un hijo, casada, comerciante de frutas, ella compra en el M. de masaya pero vende al detalle en el M. de Tipitapa, tiene un horario de trabajo pesado, inicia sus labores a las tres de la madrugada y llega a su casa hasta las seis de la tarde.

Las integrantes expresan que han tenido buenas ganancias con los créditos obtenidos, estos los invierten en temporadas que saben que hay demanda y buen precio.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Mayling Auxiliadora M. G., Juana Isabel Pérez and Ligia de los Angeles F. G..
The Mayling solidarity group is from the city of Masaya in the Quebrada region of Nicaragua. They generally sell fruits and vegetables at the Masaya and Tipitapa markets.
The three members have a great deal of confidence in each other. They are neighbours and all go in on the purchase of some products to get better prices.
Mayling Auxiliadora is single and does not have any children, but she works in order to maintain her home and help out her parents. She sells fruits and vegetables, a business she learned from her mother, and for two years now she has run it on her own. She starts working in the early hours of the morning and finishes at three in the afternoon. She hopes to achieve her goals first and then get married. She is committed to being punctual in her repayments and to encourage the group members to succeed. She is the group’s coordinator.
Juana Isabel Pérez is married without children. She is very hard-working and also sells in the market. She has many customers because she is very well-known. Her goal is to make improvements on her home to have it just the way she likes it for a comfortable retirement. She plans to invest the loan in her business in order to gain new customers and make better sales.
Ligia de los Angeles F. is a young, married mother of one. She sell fruits. She purchases her stock wholesale in the Masaya market and then sells it retail in the Tipitapa market. She has a heavy work schedule starting at three in the morning. She returns home at six in the evening.
The group members say they have made good profits with previous loans and are using these to purchase popular seasonal produce that they can get for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables wholesale to sell retail

loans.name: Alis

texts.es:
Alis es socia del Bancomunal el roble
Alis es casada tiene 41 años  4 hijos D. 25, 23, 20 y 14 años, los mayores están casados y los menores uno esta estudiando en el instituto superior y el ultimo en la escuela estatal. 
Alis es D. Trujillo, llego a Lima y estudio corte y confección, no lo ejerció por que salió embarazada y se caso, ella empezó vendiendo golosinas afuera D. un colegio, se entero que necesitaban  un guardianía para el colegio, y fue aceptada,  se puso a trabajar dentro del colegio dando menú y ha puesto un kiosco D. venta D. golosinas, le esta yendo bien.   
DesD. que Alis esta en Finca aprendió a superarse como persona y en el negocio.
Alis necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles para la comprar D. golosinas, galletas, chocolates y para compra víveres para dar   menú. 
El sueño D. Alis es tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Alis is a member of Bancomunal El Roble. She is 41 years old, and married with four children (25, 23, 20, and 14 years old). The oldest children are married, and the youngest is still studying, one in college and the other in public school. Alis is from Trujillo. She came to Lima and studied tailoring, but never worked as a tailor because she became pregnant and got married. She started to sell snacks outsiD. a school, and discovered they needed a guard for the school. She was accepted and started working insiD. the school offering meals, and she's set up a stall selling snacks there. Her business is going well. Now that she's part of Finca, Alis has been learning to better herself as a person and improve her business. Alis needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy sweets, cookies, and chocolates, as well as ingredients for the meals she sells. Alis's dream is to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets, cookies, chocolates, and ingredients for the meals she sells

loans.name: M. I. Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: María de los Santos Acuña M., María Auxiliadora R., Katty Brenda E. M. y Marina Isabel P. Rodríguez.

 El grupo solidario M.I., es formado por cuatro miembros, tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son originarios de la comarca El Hatillo de la ciudad de Masaya.

Doña María de los Santos ,  se dedica al destace de cerdo en su casa, ella vende carne, elabora nacatamales y chicharrones, todo lo vende en su casa, sus clientes son de la comunidad. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad y s conocida en su vecindario por vender nacatamales. Es soltera y vive con dos hijos mayores que le ayudan con los gastos pues trabajan en la zonas francas. Ella sueña con mejorar su cocina y comprar una refrigeradora para guardar alimentos.
 
Doña María Auxiliadora R. se dedica a la venta de perecederos en el mercado de Masaya, vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene tres hijos que van a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado donde acarrea productos, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Doña Katty Brenda es una joven mujer, madre de un hijo, vende cosméticos variados a personas de su comunidad y de comunidades vecinas, se decidió a trabaja en este negocio desde que se casó y así tener su propio ingreso para comprarse lo que ella como mujer necesita. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa trabaja como chofer de taxi, ella cuida su hijo pequeño y realiza la actividad. Es la coordinadora del grupo por ser muy responsable.

Doña Marina Isabel P., es una  joven mujer madre de un hijo pequeño en edad escolar, tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa desde hace varios años, la que ha ido creciendo poco a poco con financiamientos pequeños.Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, él es agricultor.
Ella sueña con mejorar la casa porque en los inviernos se le inunda un poco, con los créditos ella ha comprado por mayor los productos, esto le ha ayudado a incrementar las ventas y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: María de los Santos Acuña M., María Auxiliadora R., Katty Brenda E. M. y Marina Isabel P. Rodríguez. M.I. is a supportive group formed by four members. They have a lot of faith in each other. They are from the El Hatillo region in the city of Masaya. María de los Santos butchers pigs at her house. She sells the meat and makes tamales and “chicaronnes” (pork rinds). Her customers live in the community. She has been doing this for a many years, and she is well known in her neighborhood for selling tamales. She is single, and she lives with two grown children. They help with the expenses. They work in the duty-free zones. She dreams of improving her kitchen and buying a refrigerator to keep food. María Auxiliadora R. sells perishables in the Masaya market. She sells fruit, which she buys wholesale and sells at retail during the day. She has three children who go to school. Her husband is a businessman in the same market where she carries her products. He helps with the household expenses. Katty Brenda is a young woman who has one child. She sells various cosmetics to community members and neighbors. Since she got married she decided to work in this business in order to buy herself what a woman needs. Her husband helps with the household expenses by driving a taxi. She takes care of her small son and her business. She is the group’s coordinator because she is so responsible. Marina Isabel P. is a young mother with a small, school aged son. She has had a small mini market in her house for several years. The market has been growing little by little with small credits. Her husband is a farmer, and he helps with the household expenses. She dreams of improving her house because in the winter it floods a little bit. With the loans she has been able to buy wholesale products. This has helped her to increase her sales and her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and other goods to sell in mini markets

loans.name: Ideal Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Irene del Carmen Gómez, Telma Rafaela Gómez F. y Ivania del Carmen Alemán.

Este grupo es originario de la comarca El Comejen perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a las actividades de ventas de frutas y verduras , una de ellas vende ropa que elabora en su casa.
Son bien conocidas entre ellas y de confianza, son mujeres jóvenes que tienen mucho empeño y trabajar y salir adelante, les gusta trabajar con Adim porque reciben capacitaciones de cómo mejorar su negocio.

Doña Irene del Carmen es una mujer que trabaja elaborando blusas y cotonas en telas de manta típica, ella es bordadora y diseña adornos para su ropa, trabaja desde muy joven en este oficio que lo aprendió con una tía y luego cuando se casó se independizó.
Tiene cuatro niños a su cargo completamente porque se separó de su conyugue, los ha sacado adelante con su negocio, ellos estudian en la escuela cercana a su casa, dos son adolescentes y los otros pequeños pero en edad escolar primaria.
Ella ocupó el préstamo para comprar telas, hilos, adornos, etc. con esto tendrá una mayor producción ya que tiene muchos encargos de parte de sus clientes.

Doña  Telma es la coordinadora del grupo, ella anima al grupo a quedar bien y seguir obteniendo los beneficios del crédito con Adim. Es una mujer en edad madura que ha criado a sus hijos en el campo ellos ya no viven con ella, por ahora solo está con su esposo que es agricultor, él trabaja en tierras propias sembrando granos y hortalizas, inició su negocio para tener más ingresos para ayudar con los gastos, la producción la comercializa en el mercado de Masaya, cuando no hay producción compra en las comunidades cercanas las frutas de la temporada y siempre las comercializa en el mercado, ella viaja en un carretón de caballos y su horario es desde las tres de la mañana hasta las  una de la tarde.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para depender de sus hijos y  mejorar su casa, sobre todo la parte de su cocina.

Doña Ivana del Carmen Alemán es una joven señora que es madre de un niño pequeño que aún no va a la escuela, es una mujer sola con la responsabilidad de su hijo. Se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre desde que era una niña, sueña con siempre tener fuerza para trabajar y poder sacar adelante a su hijo. El crédito lo ocupó para comprar las verdura por cajas grandes y vender al detalle, esto le permite tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Photo, from left to right: Irene del Carmen Gómez, Telma Rafaela Gómez F. y Ivania del Carmen Alemán. This group comes from El Comejen region belonging to the city of Masaya. In general, the members sell fruits and vegetables and one of the members sells homemade clothes. They know and trust each other; they are young women who are very determined, and work and get ahead in life. They like to work with ADIM because they receive training in how to improve their business. Irene del Carmen is a woman who works making blouses and uniforms from the fabric of traditional blankets. She is an embroiderer and designs decorations for her clothing. From a young age she has worked in this trade, which she learned from her aunt and later worked at independently after she got married. Irene has 4 children who are completely dependent on her, because she is separated from her partner. She has given them a good start in life with her business. They attend a school near home; 2 are adolescents and the younger ones are in primary school. She took on this loan to buy fabrics, thread, decorations, etc. With these materials she will have greater production, as she already has many orders from her customers. Telma is the group coordinator, she encourages the group to work well together and keep getting the benefits of credit with ADIM. She is an older women who raised her children in the countryside. They no longer live with her, and she now lives only with her husband, who is a farmer. He works on his own land sowing grains and vegetables. Telma started her business to earn more income to help with expenses. She sells their harvest in the Masaya market. When there is nothing to sell she buys seasonal fruits from nearby communities and sells them in the market. She travels in a horse-drawn wagon and her workday begins at 3:00 a.m. and ends 1:00 p.m. Her dream is to keep working until she needs to depend on her children and to improve her house, especially the kitchen. Ivana del Carmen Alemán is a young mother with a small son who isn't old enough for school. She is a single woman with the responsibility of raising a child. She works selling fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market. She learned this activity from her mother when she was a child. Ivana dreams of always having strength to work and being able to give her son a good start in life. She took on this loan to buy vegetables in bulk to sell retail; this allows her to make a better profit.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: Camino A La Luz Group

texts.es:
Foto De izquierda a derecha: Elena Patricia M. G., María Auxiliadora Chávez y Blanca Azucena G..

Este grupo es originario del municipio de Tisma, son mujeres conocidas por la actividad económica que realizan, entre ellas tiene mucha confianza y solidaridad. 


Doña Elena Patricia es una joven mujer , casada, con un hijo pequeño, su negocio es la elaboración de venta de cajetas, manjares, dulces, etc. Trabaja con Adim porque una de las clientas le animó que se integrará en un grupo solidario, así ella conformó su grupo con dos amigas cercanas y obtuvo el préstamo. El esposo trabaja como comerciante en el mercado y a veces de ayudante en cualquier oficio.
Sueña con poder mejorar su casa y tener un puesto de cajetas en el mercado de masaya.
