loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla Y. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 47 years old. Rosevilla is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosevilla owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting "nipa" for sale which commonly use as roofing the the hut for most Filipinos. Rosevilla has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month (about US $83) for these activities.

In 2006, Rosevilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosevilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. Rosevilla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Rosevilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Jocelyn B. is a bona fide resident of Barangay Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old with four children. Her husband is a farmer.

Her rice production project is still in the growing phase. She requests a Php 5,000 loan to meet farm expenses such as fertilizers, pesticides and labor expenses. She hopes and prays that her business will increase its yield to pay for their children’s education. She is thankful for the continued assistance and support of Paglaum MPC, especially now that Kiva is helping micro-finance entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her rice field

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia L. is from Oroquieta City, Misams Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has six adult children. Sophia owns and operates a vulcanizing shop providing vulcanizing (tire) repair services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Sophia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Sophia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 12th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Mrs. Abundia D. is from Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old and is married with four children.

Due to financial insufficiency, she decided to engage in a sari-sari (variety) store so as to be of assistance in family finances, specifically in their daily basic needs. She started with minimal capital. A friend told her about Paglaum MPC - its program and services. Therefore, she decided to become a full-pledged member in August 2008.

Now, she has obtained the loan of PHP 12,000 as additional capital for her sari-sari store. She admitted that it helps a lot with their necessities. She dreams someday that the business will expand, that she will have a bigger and concrete store, that she will send their children to school and that they will live life with an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria C. is 58 years old, married with two children, and resides at Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Asteria’s loan is intended to buy vitamins and feeds for her piglets. She admitted that with the help of PMPC micofinance, her business has grown in such a way that she has a better income now than before. The family hopes to have a comfortable life someday and be able to send their children to school and have their own decent life in the future, too.

loans.use: To purcahse feeds and vitamins for her piglets

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia J. resides at Manil, Leon B. Postigo. She is forty-one years old and married to Jaime, a fisherman. She has four children: three of them are helping in generating an income. Her daughter, Liza, is her companion in running their business.

Alicia started her dried-fish vending and fish selling business in 1995 and it has served them well as their primary source of income. She sells her dried fish thrice a week during "tabo" or market day.

She commenced her membership in Paglaum in November 2008. She shows active participation in the micro-finance program. She is now applying for her first loan in the cooperative. She is very optimistic that such loan will help in developing her business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fish-vending business

location.town: Manil, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Mrs. Editha A. is 60 years old with one child. She is a widow now and resides at Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Being a widow, Mrs. A. decided to engage in food retailing to be of assistance in supplying finances, specifically for their daily basic needs and for her old age. In February 2008, she decided to be a member of Paglaum MPC. Since then, she demonstrates excellent performance in terms of loan repayments.

Now, she has obtained a loan of Php 8,000 intended for use as additional capital for her food retailing business. Her regular customers are their friends, neighbors, and relatives. She aspires to a comfortable living, and having enough income to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Business-minded Vicky S. is 31 years old, married with one child, and lives at Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

At her age, Vicky is zealous to be in business – a sari-sari (variety) store, believing that it is of great help to resolve poverty, to help the family and to fulfill one’s dream. Her regular customers are students, friends and neighbors.

Vicky has been a member of Paglaum MPC since December 2008. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional goods such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks and other household items. She's planning and looking forward to finishing in college so that she can have a brighter future and be able to help her family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nesepora

texts.en: Mrs. Nesepora E. is from Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 20 years old and married with two children. Due to financial insufficiency, she decided to engage in a sari-sari store to be of assistance in finances specifically in their daily basic needs. She started with minimal capital. A relative shared with her about Paglaum MPC – its program and services. Therefore, she decided to become a full-pledged member in February 2009. Now, she availed a loan amounting to 7,000 pesos as additional capital for the sari-sari store. She admitted that it helps a lot in their necessities. She dreams someday that the business will expand to a bigger and concrete store, that she can send their children to school and live life within the standard of living.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana G. is 28 years old. She is married and has no children at the moment. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Diana is a food vendor. She fries and sells yam with pepper in the mornings and afternoons. She sells on a tabletop at the lorry station in her community. She wants a loan to buy tubers of yam and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Diana has been in business for one year now. She aspires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia A. is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer. Felicia is a food vendor. She prepares and sells cooked yam and stew. She sells on a tabletop at the lorry station in the mornings. She wants a loan to buy tubers of yam and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Felicia has been in business for three years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena A. is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: a son and three daughters. The children are currently in school: senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Helena is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar. Helena prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes – ‘fufu’, ‘banku’, etc. Her chop bar is located at the lorry station in her community. She wants a loan to buy food items and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Helena has been in business for three years. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children good education.

loans.use: To buy food items.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. is thirty-three years old. She is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Her husband runs a provision store. Comfort trades in food items such as salted fish, vegetables, smoked fish, etc. on a table-top stall at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and from Kumasi city. Comfort also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for five years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Comfort aspires to expand her business and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy food items in bulk.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida G. is forty-five years old. She is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. Vida is a fish-monger. She sells smoked fish. She sells the fish from a tabletop stall at the market square. She also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. Vida buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them herself. She has been in this business for ten years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Karija

texts.en: Karija O. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has five children. The children, two sons and three daughters, are all currently in school: senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Karija is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells from a tabletop stall, at the lorry station, in the mornings. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Karija buys her goods from nearby communities and from Kumasi city. She has been in business for two years. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes D. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has five children. Her children, two sons and three daughters, are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer. Agnes is a trader. She trades in corn dough. She sells from a tabletop stall at the market square. She also supplies to food vendors in her community. Agnes wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She buys from nearby communities. Agnes has been in this business for four years. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is 67 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. Some are currently in the senior high and the junior high schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. She is a hardworking woman. Rose runs a provision store. She sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store on the street. She has been in business for over ten years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hoping to improve her standard of living and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa K. is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, four sons and two daughters. All are currently in the senior high and the junior high schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. She is a hardworking woman. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa own a ceramics factory. She produces items such as earthenware, pots, etc. from clay. She has hired hands. Yaa supplies her wares to retailers and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over 25 years now and wants a loan to buy clay and other working materials to expand her business. She is hoping to improve upon her standard of living and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy clay

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace K. is 24 years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a son who is currently in the primary school. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver. Grace is a baker. She bakes bread in her community and supplies to retailers and beverage sellers.  She also hawks to sell as well. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. Grace has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her son a good education.

loans.use: To buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Melania es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.
Melania es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Melania se dedica a la agricultura de papa, quinua en sus tierras de Sachabamba, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Lima. Además Melania tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Melania necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fertilizantes y para la preparación del terreno.
Los sueños de Melania son comprar mas carros, mejorar su producción y tener una tienda de repuestos.
texts.en:
Melania is a member of Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.

Melania is married, 44 years old and has 3 children. Melania farms potatoes and quinoa on her land in Sachabamba with the help of workers. She sells in the city of Lima. Furthermore, Melania has a car with which she offers urban transportation in the city of Ayacucho.

Melania needs a loan of 3500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers and for the preparation of soil.

Melania’s dreams are to buy more cars, improve her production and have a spare parts shop.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and prepare the soil

loans.name: Thania Julia

texts.es:
Thania es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.
Thania es soltera, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, de profesión Agrónoma, Thania se dedica a la confección de sabanas y edredones, tiene un taller en la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas los realiza a amigos y familiares. Además Tania vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Thania necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Thania sueña con ser una empresaria textil, sus hijos sean profesionales y que sus hijos tengan empresas.
texts.en:
Thania is a member of Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.

Thania is single, 48 years old, has four children and is a trained agronomist. Thania works sewing curtains and comforters. She has a workshop in the city of Lima. She sells to friends and family. Thania also sells cosmetics through catalogs.

Thania needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of fabrics.

Thania dreams of having a textile business and that one day her children are trained and have businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.
Margarita es casada, tiene 63 años y 6 hijos, Margarita venD. plantas ornamentales en las diferentes ferias dominicales D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, Margarita tiene un vivero en Canaan actividad que realiza con L. ayuda D. sus hijos.
Margarita necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. bolsas, semilL..
Los sueños D. Margarita son construir un local para tienda, y que sus últimos hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Las Entusiastas (The Enthusiasts) Communal Bank. Margarita is 63 years of age, married and has six children. She sells ornamental plants in the various Sunday markets in the city of Ayacucho, and she has a greenhouse in Canaan which she built with the help of her children. Margarita needs a loan of 1,000 Sols which will be invested in the purchase of containers and seeds. Her dreams are to build a location for a store and that her last children will become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy containers and seeds.

loans.name: Esther Teofila

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.
Esther es viuda, tiene 52 años y 7 hijos, Esther venD. golosinas en la puerta D. un colegio, actividad que realiza ambulatoriamente en un triciclo, además Esther prepara gelatinas, chupetes que venD. en el mismo lugar, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Esther necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa, azúcar y gelatina.
Los sueños D. Esther son construir su casa, tener una tienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the ‘Las Entusiastas’ Community Bank. She is a 52-year old widow with seven children. Every day she sells candy at a high school entrance from a pushcart; she also makes jello and popsicles which she sells at the same spot. Esther needs a loan of 900 soles to buy potatoes, sugar, and jello. Her dream is to build her own home, own a store, and have children with good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, sugar, and jello

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.
Moisés es viudo, tiene 73 años y 3 hijos, Moisés se dedica al reciclaje de plásticos, chatarra, productos que almacena en su casa y luego los comercializa a intermediarios. Además Moisés vende túnicas, velos, Biblias en su iglesia, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Moisés necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de túnicas y Biblia.
Los sueños de Moisés son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Moisés is a member of ‘Las Entusiastas’ Community Bank. He is a 73-year old widower and has three children. To earn a living Moisés recycles plastics and scrap metal which he stores in his house before selling to other vendors. He also buys religious garments, veils, and Bibles in Lima and then sells them at his church. Moisés needs a loan of 1250 soles to buy more garments and Bibles. His dream is to have a better business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy religious garments and Bibles

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.
Angelica es soltera, tiene 21 años y 2 hijos, Angélica tiene juegos de playstation en su casa, juegos que alquila por horas, su negocio esta cerda de un colegio, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Angelica necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento de los equipos.
Los sueños de Angelica son comprar mas juegos y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of ‘Las Entusiastas’ Community Bank. She is single, 21 years old, and has two children. In her home she has PlayStations that she rents out by the hour—she does this every day. Angelica needs a 1000 sole loan so that she can keep the games properly maintained. Her dream is to buy more games, and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For PlayStation maintenance

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.
Edith es soltera, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Edith tiene una tienda en la ciudad de Pichari, en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos para carros, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana, además Edith vende sus repuestos a pedido.
Edith necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
Los sueños de Edith son tener una casa con todos las comodidades, ampliar su negocio y proveer a instituciones.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the communal bank “Las Entusiastas.” She is single, 30 years old, and has a son. Edith rents a store space in Pichari, where she sells spare parts for cars with her sister’s help. Edith sells her wares by order. She needs a loan of 1,250 soles to buy spare parts. Edith would like to have a house with all the accompanying comforts, to grow her business, and to supply institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de repuestos.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Isabel es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Isabel vende comida típica en la feria de platos típicos, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos con la ayuda de su esposo y otro ayudante.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo, papa, maíz, ají.
Los sueños de Isabel son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa y tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank “Suni” which means “Abundant” in Quechua. Isabel lives with her partner, is 39 years old, and has two children. Isabel sells traditional food in the typical food market on Saturdays and Sundays. Her husband helps her and she has an assistant. Isabel needs a loan of 1,500 soles to buy rice, spaghetti, potatoes, corn, and chili pepper. Isabel has dreams of buying some land to build a house on and have a store in a stable place.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, fideo, papa, maíz, ají.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Marilu es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 3 hijos, Marilu tiene juegos de billar que alquila por horas, su negocio esta en su casa que se ubica cerca de un colegio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Marilu necesita un préstamo de 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios para las mesas de billar.
Los sueños de Marilu son ampliar la construcción de su casa para un restaurante y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marilu is a member of the communal bank “Suni,” which means “Abundant” in Quechua. Marilu lives with her partner, is 41 years old, and has three children. Marilu has billiard tables in her home that she rents out by the hour. Her home is located near a high school and her children help her with the business. Marilu needs a loan of 750 soles to buy accessories for the billiard tables. Marilu would love to expand her house so she could open a restaurant. She also wants her children to finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de accesorios para las mesas de billar.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Genoveva es viuda, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Genoveva vende leña en su casa, producto que adquiere de los productores, además Genoveva vende golosinas en la puerta del colegio Abraham Valdelomar de manera ambulatoria.
Genoveva necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Genoveva son tener una tienda y que sus hijas culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The name of Genoveva’s Community Bank is Suni, which means abundant in Quechua. Genoveva is 40, a widow, and has two children. Genoveva sells wood in her house. She gets the wood from wood producers. Genoveva also sells sweets as a street vendor in the entrance to the Abraham Valdelomar School. Genoveva needs a loan for 1,250 PEN to buy wood. Genoveva’s dreams are to have a store and that her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Julia es viuda, tiene 63 años y 6 hijos, Julia venD. refrescos y mazamorras en la feria D. platos típicos que se realiza los días sábados y domingos, mientras que los demás días venD. comida en la puerta D. la fiscalia D. manera ambulatoria.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, maíz morado.
Los sueños D. Julia son que sus 2 nietos culminen sus estudios y tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
The name of Julia’s Community Bank is Suni, which means abundant in Quechua. Julia is 63, a widow, and has six children. Julia sells soft drinks and “mazamorras” (dessert maD. of purple corn boiled with pieces of pineapple and other fruits) at the fair that sells typical dishes. She does this on Saturdays and Sundays. The other days of the week she sells food as a street vendor in the entrance to the Prosecutor’s Office. Julia needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy sugar and purple corn. Julia’s dreams are for her two grandchildren to complete their education and to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and purple corn

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Martha es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Martha tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, leña, verduras, carne, gas, además prepara chupetes que también vende en su tienda.
Martha necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, fideo y leña.
Los sueños de Martha son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio para tener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Community Bank Suni which means Plenty in quechua. Marths is married, she is 45 years old and has 4 children, Martha has a store at her house where she sells groceries, wood, vegetables, meat, gas and also prepares and sells ice pops at her store. Martha needs a loan of 2000 soles that will be invested to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, noodles and wood. Martha's dream is that her children turn into professionals, and to grow her business to increase her profit.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, noodles and good.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Margarita es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Margarita junto a su esposo viajan a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compran animales que vende en la feria dominical de Ayacucho, además compra quesos que vende por mayor.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno.
Los sueños son tener un negocio estable, un tractor agrícola y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Community Bank Suni which means Plentiful in quechua. Margarita lives with her partner, she is 32 years old and has 2 children, Margarita and her husband travel to different fairs in the region where they buy animals that they sell at the Sunday fair in Ayacucho, she also buys cheese that sells at wholesale prices. Margarita needs a loan of 1000 soles which will be invested to buy livestock. Her dreams are to have a stable business, a tractor for her farm and that her children turn into professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Nancy es viuda, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Nancy tiene un taller de pintura y fibra de vidrio en un local alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de un personal. Además tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas en el mismo lugar.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pintura y fibra de vidrio.
Los sueños de Nancy son ampliar su taller y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Community Bank Suni which means Plentiful in quechua. Nancy is a widow and she is 37 years old and has 4 children, Nancy has a painting and fiber glass workshop at a place she rents, she has the help of people she employs. She also has a small business selling beverages at the same place. Nancy needs a loan of 750 soles that will be invested to buy paint and fiber glass. Her dreams are to extend her workshop and that her children turn into professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint and fiber glass

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Lucila es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Lucila se dedica a la preparación de comida, brinda sus servicios para diferentes agasajos de instituciones. Además Lucila tiene proyectado implementar una granja de cuy.
Lucila necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de implementos para galpones.
Lucila sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the Village Bank called Suni, which means Abundant in Quechua. Luclia is married, is 38 years old and has two children. Lucila prepares food, providing her services for institutions’ various events. Additionally, Luclia plans to start a guinea pig farm. Lucia needs a loan of 750 soles that she will use to buy equipment for sheds. Lucila dreams about her children becoming professionals and about improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment for sheds

loans.name: Elvira Del Socorro

texts.es: Elvira es soltera, de 44 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos casados con 2 nietos uno de cada hijo, trabaja como subdelegada del MINED de Santo Tomas con 24 años de servicio, está solicitando su 1er credito para utilizarlo en la instalacion de los servicios basicos como son agua potable y energia electrica, ya que estos servicios los recibe a traves de vecinos, pero no quiere continuar con esta situacion ya que un dia se puede volver un problema, por tal razon quiere hacerlo por su cuenta, su compañero trabaja fuera de la ciudad, pero le brinda ayuda para los gastos del hogar.  Plantea que la situacion esta dificil y por lo tanto hay que recurrur a los prestamos para salari adelante con los proyectos.  La profesora utiliza los fines de semana para vender comida a los estudiantes de la universidad, ya que le queda a media cuadra y es una forma de obtener ingresos
texts.en:
Elvira is 44-years old and single; she has 2 married children and 4 grandchildren. She has served for 24 years as a subdelegate of MINED of Santo Tomas. Elvira is requesting her first loan to install basic services such as potable water and electricity. She currently gets these services through neighbors, but doesn't want to continue this way, since any given day there could be a problem. For this reason, she wants to officially set up these services in her home. Her partner works outside of the city, but helps her with household expenses. However, this causes a difficult situation and therefore Elvira has to resort to taking out loans to cover costs. The professor makes use of the weekends to sell food to the university students, since she lives only half a block away and it is another way to earn income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of potable water and electricity

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Yamileth es soltera, de 51 años de edad, trabaja como Delegada de Educacion en el Municipio de Santo Tomas, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores los que habitan con ella, aportan para los gastos del hogar, tiene un horario de trabajo de 8 a 5 pm. En tiempos normales, pero la mayoria del tiempo no tiene horario de salida, esta solicitando su 1er credito para utilizarlo para cambiar el techo de su casa, ya que esta bastante deteriorado y con el invierno se moja, pues quiere que sus hijos, sus nietos y ella tener un poco de tranquilidad en este invierno.  Se le conoce como una persona responsable, honesta y con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Yamileth is 51-years old and unmarried. She works as Education Representative in the Santo Tomas municipality. She has 3 grown-up children who live with her and help out with household expenses. Yamileth's work schedule is from 8:00 to 5:00 p.m. during normal times, but usually she doesn't have a set schedule. She is requesting her first loan to replace the roof of her home. It is rather run down and leaks in the winter, so she wants her children and grandchildren to have peace of mind this winter. Yamileth is known as a responsible, honest person with a sincere desire to overcome any challenges.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the roof of her house

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Teresa es soltera, de 27 años de edad, trabaja como maestra popular, ademas realiza labores domesticas en casa de un amigo donde recibe remuneracion, esta solicitando su 1er credito el que utilizara para reforzar su negocio de venta de ropa nueva que realiza los fines de semana en puertos de montaña, tiene 4 años de servicio en MINED Santo Tomas como maestra popular.  Podemos decir que la delegada del MINED se ha comprometido con la retencion de su salario para el pago de sus cuotas y el resto de profesoras que es un grupo de 4 estaran pendientes del cumplimiento de pago del credito.  En el negocio a ella le va muy bien, pues cuenta con experiencia y clientela seleccionada que nunca le quedan mal.
texts.en:
Teresa is single, 27 years old, and works as a teacher. Additionally, she does housework at her friend’s house where she receives remuneration. She is asking for her first loan which she will use to strengthen her business by selling new clothing on mountain passes on the weekends. She has served 4 years as a teacher at MINED Santo Tomas. The representative of MINED has promised to withhold her salary for the payment of her dues, and the rest of the professors in her group of 4 will be waiting for her to complete her loan repayment. In business she does very well, relying on her experience and selected clientele that never let her down.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New clothing sales

loans.name: Marling Aleyda

texts.es: Marling Aleyda es casada, de 28 años de edad, es Lic. En Admon. De Empresas, trabaja como secretaria en la Delegacion del MINED de Santo Tomas con 5 años de servicio, su esposo es Ing. Agronomo y trabaja en la Alcaldia de Santo Tomas, ambos aportan con los gastos del hogar, tienen un niño de 3 años, ella esta solicitando su primer credito el cual sera utilizado para mejorar su vivienda y terminar de contruir un muro para proteger la viivienda, porque con la lluvia esta erosionando y se le va a caer la casa, poir ese motivo desea hacer la inversion para evitar que el agua del invierno le destruya su vivienda, pues quiere garantizar la salud de su familia y la seguridad de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marling Aleyda is 28-years old and married. She has a bachelor's degree in Business Administration and has served for 5 years as secretary of the Delegation of MINED in Santo Tomas. Her husband is an agronomist and works in the mayor's office in Santo Tomas. They both contribute their income to household expenses, and have a 3-year old son together. Marling is requesting her first loan which will be used to improve her home and finish constructing a wall to protect the house, because erosion caused by the rain could bury it. For this reason she wishes to invest in a way to prevent the water from destroying her house, assuring the health of her family and the safety of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of wall

loans.name: Seela

texts.en:
Seela E., 54, is married with seven children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and village people four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala.

Seela has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack sprayer, chemicals, knives, a spade and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa S., 40, is married and has 4 children. She has 1 year of experience in the bingo business. She sells to the villagers 2 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~110 USD). SPBD loans are Rosa’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase another bingo machine and supplies.

loans.name: Tulagatasi

texts.en: Tulagatasi A., 38, is married and has 7 children. She has experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and people of the village 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~ 90 USD). SPBD loans are Tulagatasi’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack, sprayer, chemicals, knives, spade, chainsaw.

loans.name: Oliana

texts.en:
Oliana S., 36, is married with three children.  She has two years of experience in her vegetable business. She sells to the villagers four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala.

She has no previous loan with SPBD.  SPBD loans are Oliana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, a wheelbarrow, a rake and chemicals

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili S., 41, is married with five children. She is in the plantation business and sells to the public and village people four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala.

She has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Saili’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack sprayer, knives, chemicals, seeds, spade, etc.

loans.name: Toeafe

texts.en:
Toeafe S., 30, is married with four children. She has 1 year of experience in her shop. She sells to the village people and public seven days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala.

She has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Toeafe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase freezers, tinned food, soap, etc.

loans.name: Palapala

texts.en:
Palapala F., 64, is married with five children. She is in the plantation business. She sells to the public and village people three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala.

She has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Palapala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack sprayer, knives, chemicals, seeds, a spade, etc.

loans.name: Vaovai

texts.en: Vaovai F. L., 63, is married with 9 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~ USD).  SPBD loans are Vaovai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knapsack sprayer, knives, chemicals, seeds, spade, etc.

loans.name: Avei

texts.en:
Avei M., 28, is married with 4 children. She has 2 years of experience in the bakery business. She sells to the public and village people 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~ USD).

SPBD loans are Avei’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to hire more staff for her business, and also for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase sack of flour, sugar, tank of oil,  and other things used for bakery

loans.name: Logogalu

texts.en:
Logogalu P., 41, is married with 3 children. She has experience in the bakery business. She sells to the village school and people 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~ USD).

SPBD loans are Logogalu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy a sack of flour and sugar for her business, and also for her home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase sack of flour, sugar, tank of oil, etc.

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en:
Elenoa P. , 33, is married with five children. She has one year of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the public and village people four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala.

Elenoa has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack sprayer, chemicals, knives, a spade and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Tinei

texts.en:
Tinei F., 32, is married with six children. She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and village people four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala.

Tinei has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack sprayer, chemicals, knives, a spade and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Rusia

texts.en: Rusia T., 30, is married with one child.  She has one year of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the public and village people four days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala.  SPBD loans are Rusia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase knapsack sprayer, chemicals, knives, spade, wheel barrow, and seeds

loans.name: Taesega

texts.en: Taesega A., 60, is married with eight children.  She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and village people four days per week. She has one previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala.  SPBD loans are Taesega’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knapsack sprayer, chemicals, knives, spade, wheel barrow

loans.name: Nuumasaga

texts.en: Nuumasaga V., 39, is married with four children.  She has one year of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the public and village people five days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala.  SPBD loans are Nuumasaga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knapsack sprayer, chemicals, knives, spade, wheel barrow, and seeds

loans.name: Vaoiva

texts.en:
Vaoiva M., 50, is married with eight children. She has many years of experience in the chicken farm business. She sells to the public and villagers during every day of the week.

Vaoiva has requested a loan in order to buy tools, such as materials to build fences for the housing of her chickens. This will be her first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145).

SPBD loans are Vaoiva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is very happy to obtain this loan and hopes to become a long-term participant in the program. She appreciates their much-needed help.

loans.use: To buy tools such as materials to build fences for the housing of her chickens

loans.name: Pina

texts.en: Pina P., age 35, is married and has one child.  She has one year of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the public and villagers three days per week. This is her first loan from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Pina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks. She is very thankful to the program for providing financial help to her to develop her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and equipment that she needs for her business

loans.name: Sei

texts.en:
Sei V., 46, is widowed with five children. She has two years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the public and villagers three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 420 Tala (~175 USD). She has one previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Sei’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is happy to stay for a long time in the program because she believes it helps the most in supporting her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as mutton flaps, french fries, tomato sauce, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Loretta

texts.en:
Loretta V., 21, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the public and villagers five days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Loretta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She’s thankful for the program and the opportunity she has in getting financial help to assist her family.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and ingredients for making pancakes like flour, sugar, cooking oil and plastic bags

loans.name: Alofamoni

texts.en:
Alofamoni W., 30, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Alofamoni’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is very appreciative of the financial help she receives from the program, and wishes to stay in the program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, tools and chemicals needed for good growth

loans.name: Maletina

texts.en:
Maletina R., 44, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers two days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). She has three previous loans with SPBD. This loan will also be used to buy cement and tools needed for repairing her house.

SPBD loans are Maletina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This program provides good assistance to her and her family which is very different for her than when she started.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, fertilizers and tools for her business and to use for house repair

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia N., 29, is married with three children. She has one year of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the public and villagers three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). She has one previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Leonia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is very happy and appreciative of the good help she gets from the program.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and tools needed for making her BBQ business successful

loans.name: Tumua

texts.en:
Tumua S., 49, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in her plantation and vegetable garden business. She sells to the public and villagers three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). She has three previous loans with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Tumua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is happy to support the program because she believes it gives her much help in her financial need.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, tools and pesticides for improving her business

loans.name: Tiomai

texts.en:
Tiomai F., 46, is married with six children. She has many years of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers two days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). She has two previous loans with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Tiomai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is very appreciative of the financial help she gets from the SPBD program in supporting her family through her business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and equipment needed for her business

loans.name: Fealofani

texts.en:
M. Fealofani, 30, is married with two children. She has four years of experience in her taxi business. She provides transportation to the general public seven days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are M.’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase new tires and pay for taxi registration

loans.name: Mireta

texts.en:
Mireta F., 41, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers two days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 410 Tala (~170 USD). She has one previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Mireta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is so happy the way her family is improving now, just because of the help she got from the SPBD program.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizers, farming equipment and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Faatasiga

texts.en:
Faatasiga T., 40, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers two days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 380 Tala (~158 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Faatasiga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is happy to stay a long time in the program and get more help for running her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers, farming equipment and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Delphin

texts.en:
Delphin P., 22, is married with one child. She has two years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the general public five days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Delphin’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, fabrics, threads and zippers

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina T., 37, is married with six children. She has many years of experience in the sewing and elei printing business (a style of cloth printing which is unique to Samoa and is used in much of Samoan clothing). She sells to the public and villagers five days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). She has three previous loans with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Penina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This program helps the most in improving her family’s living standard which is very different than it was in the beginning.

loans.use: To purchase cotton materials, needles, thread and a new sewing machine to replace the old one

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora S., age 31, is married and has four children. She has many years of experience growing and selling vegetables. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. This is her first loan from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Flora’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks.  She appreciated the help she got from the program to improve her family's living standards and is happy to continue with the loan program.

loans.use: Purchase weed killer, a wheel barrow and farming equipment, such as knives, spades and axes.

loans.name: Faaluaina

texts.en: Faaluaina Talailemotu, age 50, is married and has five children. She has 2 years of experience in the popcorn business. She sells to the public and villagers five days per week. She has had two previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 360 Tala (~150 USD).  SPBD loans are Faaluaina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks.  She is thankful that the program is supporting her family and she is happy to continue participating for a long time.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of corn seeds, gallon of cooking oil, salt, and plastic papers.

loans.name: Toalima

texts.en: Toalima H., age 30, is married and has three children. She has many years of experience in the farming business.  She sells to the general public 6 days per week.  She has had one previous loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala.  SPBD loans are Toalima’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to pay her children's school fees. Her husband works at Yazaki to earn extra income.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals such as pesticides, weed killer, fertilizers, gromozones, and bush knives.

loans.name: Teleni

texts.en: Teleni M., age 43, is married and has three children. She has two years of experience in the making and selling pancakes and banana chips. She sells to the village people and the public 5 days per week. She has had one previous loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Teleni’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks. She will use some of her loan for home improvement. She is doing well with her business, but just needs support to maintain and improve it.

loans.use: To purchase flour, oil, a deep frying pan, and sugar

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia S., age 43, is married and has five children.  She has one year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the village people/public 7 days per week. She has had no previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Itagia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She will use her entire loan for her business. She started the business, but she needs more help to maintain and improve it.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cordial, plastic cups, and chinese candies for flavor.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina F., age 32, is married and has four children.  She has 5 years of experience in the flea market business.  She sells to the tourists and general public 6 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala.SPBD loans are Rosalina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase kava bowls of different sizes, samoan war weapons, and tapa table mats to sell

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en: Fetu M., age 59, is married and has two children. She has 7 years of experience in the sewing business.  She sells to the general public 7 days per week.  This is her first loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala SPBD loans are Fetu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, special oil for the machine, fabric, and sewing supplies, such as scissors, needles and thread.
